Reviews.Title: “Just Right!”
Reviews.Author: Dean0K
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Panorama is not too stuffy and not too fancy - and it is a definitely a fantastic value when compared to lesser hotels in Venice proper. The good news is that the hotel is right next to the water bus terminal, and for the modest price of a week-long pass you can be anywhere in the area in short order, including Venice, Murano and Burano. The bad news is also that the hotel is immediately adjacent to the water bust stop, and the canopy will partially obscure the lagoon view from some rooms. Breakfasts were excellent, and when I was there with my family the staff was indeed making cappuccinos and espressos with the fancy machine in the dining hall. The hotel staff were very helpful, although I suspect a bit to croneyism on the topic of recommended restaurants - you should depend on TripAdvisor for that! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “My trip to Italy”
Reviews.Author: Tom R
Reviews.Content: The hotel Panorama was a nice hotel. The staff was very helpful and it was a clean place to stay.It was very nice to stay on the water and easy to walk across the street to the water bus. They also got us a free ride to and from the island of Murano where they make the famous glass. It is not in the heart of Venice but the price was good and it was only a 15 minute ride to St. Marks and the boats run often. I recommend this hotel,the food and beach on the island of Lido were great!! Ciao!!

Reviews.Title: “Views across the Lagoon to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Gina B
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Hotel Panorama. I stayed at Easter 2011 and just arranged for my parents to stay there at Easter 2012. The staff recognised the connection and allocated my parents a lovely large room with views across the Lagoon to Venice. The hotel is located opposite the Lido water taxi/Alilaguna station and close to the main Gran Viale street. The hotel is clean, comfortable and offers superb value for money. The staff are very friendly and helpful, they will provide you with maps and tips and also arrange for a private water taxi to take you to Murano to visit the glass factory if you wish (free boat ride and no obligation to buy anything). We stayed 2 nights in the heart of Venice and then stayed 2 nights here on the Lido to escape the hustle and bustle of Venice. The beach is lovely and it is fun to hire a tandem bike to explore the whole island. I will return to Hotel Panorama for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, beautiful view!”
Reviews.Author: Marcela G
Reviews.Content: Just came back from spending 3 night there. We had room 303 which is in the top floor. The room was big and clean, so was the bathroom. The only downside the this room is that there is no shower, only a tub. so, if you don't like baths, this is not the room for you. The staff was great always willing to help and answer questions. The location, is great best decision! it is quite and has easy access, way better that the noisy streets of the center of Venice. It was great to spend the day in Venice, and then take the vaporetto to the Hotel. Transportation is super easy and you cant miss the hotel from the vaporetto stop. this is great when you have your suite cases. it is also, easy to get to the airport and train station. Breakfast was great, plenty to choose from and the girl that works the breakfast room is super nice. Tip: buy the vaporetto ticket for the length of your stay, it will save you a lot of money from the individual ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: maggie b
Reviews.Content: I canâ€™t think of my bad thing to say. To start, Francesca was awesome. She was so helpful and always made time to answer questions and give great tips. The rooms were very spacious for Europe. The location was awesome. Arriving from the airport was so easy. We got on the Lido taxi and as soon as we arrived at the Lido stop, we could see the hotel. Lido was a great area full of locals. We never felt unsafe in Venice and on Lido. The beach was very close and nice. The only con to this review would be a restaurant they suggested on three different occasions, the restaurants was overpriced and horrible. Itâ€™s on the main street, its white on the front with a large cover outdoor sitting area. The hotel hands out their business cards. Venice is beautiful, but be smart about where you eat and shop. Weâ€™ve been all over Europe and Venice is by far the most expensive place to shop and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Second time at Hotel Panorama”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary in 2007 at Hotel Panorama and decided to return for our 25th silver wedding anniversary. This time I pushed the boat out and booked the junior suite at the front of the hotel so we could enjoy the views. I also pre-booked some flowers for the room. It was only a three night stay so I sort restaurant suggestions from the hotel before arriving and they were very helpful with suggestions which I could then research before arrival. Why return? 1. Location. A)Virtually all the water buses pass through the Lido making it easy to get to any where in Venice and the neighboring islands. I thought it would be a good idea to take the line 5 road bus to Venice and then get the local waterbus to the Lido but that was not a good plan. Take the waterbus from the airport to the Lido (1hr) as it is much more relaxing and easier to do. No dragging cases over bridges. I paid the extra to return to the airport by waterbus. B)The view from the front of the hotel is wonderful. OK the new water bus station can creep into some camera shots from the 1st floor but morning, noon and night looking across to St Marks square is a real treat. I even managed to get our chair on to the veranda to sit in the sun and watch the world go by and read my book. C) You don't get knocked down by herds of tourists as you step out of the hotel, but mind the road traffic which is present on the Lido. 2. The staff. Having already been in discussion about our needs we had a warm welcome from the staff who were pleased to make our restaurant reservation for the following night. Cases taken to the room where the pre-ordered flowers were ready and looked lovely, plus two glasses of fizzy wine and a snack. The day of the big meal did not go well as my wife suffered from a migraine for most of the day. No problem the staff cancelled the restaurant reservation. The next day with the wife feeling better after breakfast we took advantage with another couple of being taken by private taxi boat for free which the hotel arranges to a glass works on Murano. We went on by bus to Burano. On return we asked the staff to make a reservation again with the restaurant and they obviously passed on details of our anniversary as we were surprised by 3 singing waiters and a cake with candles after our main course. When I wanted to use the internet to check in for our flight and reserve seats they kindly let me use the office pc so I could print off the boarding passes although they do have a customer pc for web access. 3. The hotel has a majestic decor inside whilst appearing well kept outside. The junior suite with 2 small verandas to get the most of those views has two large wash basins, a jacuzzi bath (used twice a day, plenty of hot water, go easy on the bubble bath!), toilet and bidet, shower cubicle and fresh towels each day. The bed was comfortable and extra pillows were made available. No tea making facilities but minibar at not too unreasonable prices in room along with safe with key.The rooms are tastefully decorated in Venicean style, clean and tidy and well kept. We forgot to use the shutters until the last night to keep the sun out. Up to date small tv with good picture and lots of Italian programs and MTV. Breakfast room is very nice, some may find the choice of breakfast items limited (no hot food) but there is plenty there to see you through to lunch. No lunch or dinner at the hotel but excellent Pizzeria to the right and 5+ other restaurants of varying price within 100m. Expect to pay EUR50 for two people at most places though. Our celebration meal topped EUR150 but was excellent. If you find anything wrong while staying there simply ask the staff politely to investigate and correct it. Yes we hope to go back again but we will make sure it is for at least 4 nights not 3.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent views”
Reviews.Author: borrowedtheboots
Reviews.Content: A front room at this hotel gives splendid views across the lagoon towards St Marco and the whole of Venice. The vaporetti stops right outside and the rooms are luxurious. There is no restaurant except a breakfast room, but in Venice who needs to stay in one place toeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Among friends...”
Reviews.Author: carlosbar
Reviews.Content: Before writing about the hotel, let me talk about the staff. No one wants to have troubles when traveling, right? But, unfortunately, this happens, and when it happens all you want is to be among friends. That's what you are going to find in this incredible hotel. Because of the enormous cold Italy has faced these days our car has been freezed and stopped working just when we were leaving the hotel. Trouble hum? Not at all! We just had to sit down, relax and let the Eugenio, the front desk gentleman handle all the trouble. (including contact Sixt (rent-a-car), local mechanics, etc.). This is the most friendship treatment I've ever received in all hotels I've been. Fantastic! Now about the hotel: Location: The hotel is not located in Venice itself, Lido is an island in front of Venice (about 1 mile away). In my personal opinion, I would not stay in Venice because most of hotels are located in places without car access, and as I travel with a lot of luggages, it will not be easy to carry it in that tiny aisles of Venice. Besides that, Lido is a more modern-city-like island than Venice, then again, another personal taste. Just in front of the hotel (10 meters) there are boats to Venice every 10-20 minutes, 24hs a day, 7 days a week, all the year. When I say boats, this is more like buses, very comfortable seats and, as there are no waves in this area, very stable -- even for me that have dizziness issues I had no problems. The ticket is 6.5 euros per person, one way, kids don't pay. Surrounding the hotel there are bakerys, restaurants, bars and coffee-shopps. Infrastructure: This is an old building from the outside view, but from the inside this is a quite fancy one. All the floors covered with marbles, beautiful view of the beach and Venice from the breakfast room, comfortable and cozy rooms with very well equipped restroom. Our room didn't have bathtub, but we were told this is possible to book it (if this is done with time) for the same price. The breakfast is light, does not include hot plates, which made no difference for myself. Pros: Friendship (Nicest staff in Italy), good rooms, calm, quite, beautiful view. Cons: For some people it's a con not being in Venice itself.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca B
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend had booked our first trip to Venice as a surprise for my birthday, I was pleasantly surprised by his choice of location and everything else he had arranged. Hotel Panorama (HP) is in an excellent location, the waterbus stop is right across the road and the main street with shops, restaurants etc is around the corner up the next street. The staff are all very welcoming and always there for advice and tips on what to do, where to go. The room was nice and spacious with a decent sized bathroom, we stayed in room 207 on the 2nd floor. The view was lovely from our room, we could see right across the lagoon. As other reviews state, it is nice to be across the water and away from the the mainland, with only a short ride on the waterbus. All in all the hotel is in a great location and I would highly recommend it to all, we had a fabulous stay.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel right on the water”
Reviews.Author: panjegoli
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night and we were impressed. The hotel is situated on the Lido island which is about 30min boat ride away from Venice.The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was one of the best we had in Italy and the bonus was that it was served in a room overlooking the water. The only disappointment was that although we booked our room well in advance, we were told that the only room available in on the first floor which had no view at all. Apparently there was a better room on a higher floor which they gave to someone who just walked in earlier with no reservation. Overall, if you are looking for a nice, peaceful place to stay which is away from the crowd and yet close enough, this hotel would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A great way to see Venice without the craziness”
Reviews.Author: Todd M
Reviews.Content: This was our final and best hotel we stayed at when we visited Italy, during our honeymoon. I thought staying on Lido, rather than Venice would be a pain. I was wrong. The island is a nice place to get away from the humanity on Venice. PROS: -The hotel is located on Lido, next to the boat terminal. This ideal location, made getting back and forth a snap. -The view from our room was beautiful, and the streets were quiet. -The hotel is nicely decorated, and looks very classy. -The bathroom was fairly modern, clean, and roomy. -The front desk employees were very helpful and courteous. -The hotel is right off the water, which produces a nice sea breeze. -The airconditioner was cool, and worked well. -This hotel had TWO elevators. This was a first for us. -The stairway was elegant, open, and airy. -The water pressure and temperature were good. -This hotel had facial tissues! -HP has SKY TV which gave us a few more TV options rather than the other places we stayed. -This was the first hotel we stayed at with actual stationery. -The breakfast was filling, and featured fruits, pasteries, meats, and cheeses. CONS: -Our toilet seat had a crack in it. It didn't affect usage, but it is something I'd replace if I was the hotel owner. -We were on the second floor, and sometimes street noise could be heard. Not as bad as when we were in Rome, though. -One side of our room had a view of the building behind us. This was room 201. -The safe was very small, and featured an actual key. -This is another hotel where you have to give them your hotel key each time you leave. -The shower was a tad small, and the doorway to the shower can be tight for big people. -HP doesn't have curtians, but window dressings and wooden shudders. It's pretty much all or nothing with window privacy. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The staff, location, and hotel made it one of the more peaceful points during our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and exceptional stay at the Panorama Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotelz001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superb - a great choice when one considers service, location and the value it offers. I was a guest not a number, felt so esteemed by the hotel staff and management. On day 1 was given a ground floor room near the reception when the hotel was full. As soon as more hotel rooms got free Davide from management offered me a change of room. That was appreciated. An upgrade! Moreover, this hotel is recommended for its location. It is just opposite the berthing station of the Lido. There are boats going to Venice day and night. There are restaurants, bakery, supermarket, many shops and the bus station right around the corner. There is a market at the Lido too which offers local food products, fresh fruits and vegetables. Thanks to a suggestion tip from the receptionist Francesca had the opportunity to visit and enjoy. Moreover, the personal service that these people offer is wonderful. Just got suggestions to visit non-touristic sites too. Davide suggested Chioggia which has been an excellent suggestion despite the rain â€¦ must visit an off the track sites too. Davide even phoned a place which is not open to tourists. The availability of these people is marvelous. What can I say about breakfast! It was generous. There was a choice of hams, liver pastes, cheeses, sliced bread and rolls, crackers, jams, honey, chocolate spread, juices, teas, coffee, water, yoghurt, boiled eggs, fruits, croissants. Cannot but praise the choice of food that this hotel offers for breakfast. Much appreciated service and friendliness â€“ special thanks goes to Davide, Francesca and Giulio who are very helpful, polite and caring. Thanks goes also to the ladies doing the cleaning and serving breakfast. Till now the Panorama Hotel was the best hotel I have been to in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on Lido Island, Venice”
Reviews.Author: Ylorac
Reviews.Content: I really like staying on Lido because it is away from all the tourist attractions of Venice. Lido is a beautiful little island just across the waterway from Venice. It is an easy water taxi ride to all of Venice. Our hotel room was large with a skylight and open window to enjoy the evening breezes. The room was well appointed with a jacuzzi and shower and a separate room for the bidet and toilet. Our breakfast was included and it was a bit dissapointing as the coffee was from a Nescape instant coffee machine and was terrible. They had an espresso machine, but did not offer it although I asked for it once. For Italy, espresso should be the coffee served, not instant. The hotel staff was helpful, yet reserved. They were always availble to make suggestions and help us with trying to get our airline tickets printed out.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous stay at the Panorama”
Reviews.Author: JaneOManchester
Reviews.Content: It is a shame that they have extended the vaporetta station in front of the hotel so that you don't get the full sweep of the lagoon whilst eating breakfast in the dining room but you can still see the Doge's Palace and the Campanile of St Mark's Basilica (San Marco). You can still watch the cruise liners turn in front of the hotel and then make their stately way up the Guidecca Canal. The hotel still therefore lives up to its name, offering a Panoramic view of the lagoon. If you take breakfast on the terrace you will see the unparelled view of the Venetian lagoon and watch the endless flow of water traffic. Try to get a room with a lagoon view, it literally will make your holiday special. The staff are friendly and very helpful, especially Eugenio who has welcomed us to the hotel over a number of years. We missed Sabrina but wish her well with her new baby daughter. If you are uncertain about anything then ask staff for advice and they will be very willing to offer tips and advice on any aspect of the city or travel. The hotel is not situated on the main island of Venice, but on the Lido, a separate island a short vaporetta ride away. The Lido offers a number of restaurants and bars close to the hotel. You may have to book for the Gran Viale or eat early. Others will probably be able to accommodate you immediately or after a short wait. The Vaporetta (waterbus) stops right in front of the hotel. We love the ride across the lagoon in the morning and back again at night. It adds an extra dimension to the holiday. The Vaporetta No. 1 is the main tourist choice as it goes the full length of the grand canal. It starts at the Lido so if you want a seat at the front with the best view then you have a much better chance of getting this if you stay on the Lido. I particularly love doing the trip at night when the buildings are lit up and you can see the wonderful chandeliers in the palaces and hotels and their reflection in the canal. You can also take trips on other routes around Venice or visit other islands from the Lido. One tip, if you visit St Mark's then do so at lunchtime when the lights are on to illuminate the magnificent golden ceiling with its wonderful mosaics. Check the web for times but when were were there they went on at 11.30 and are on for an hour. If you go up the stairs to the right just inside the door (before you actually enter the basilica itself) you will be right up close to the mosaics and get the best experience. From here you also can go out onto the balcony overlooking the square. The rooms at the hotel are clean and comfortable and they offer a continental breakfast of ham, cheese, eggs, toast, cereal and cakes. If you are looking for a swimming pool or spa then don't stay here as they are not on offer. If, however, you are looking for a hotel where you will find a warm welcome, be well looked after and have one of the best views of Venice then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: shayor
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Panorama now either 7 or 8 times. Does that not say it all? Perfect location, lovely staff and the best view in the world! Being on the Lido also offers good value restaurants; is away from the bustle of Venice itself and you have the joy of the vaporetta ride across the Lagoon to San Marco, etc. If you break down the component parts, you could find better - breakfast at the Palacio Foscari for example - but for the complete package then this is the only place we would go, and we keep on going!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - Simple Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Bryan H
Reviews.Content: I only had one night to stay in Venice, and was recommended to try the Hotel Panorama by a friend who had been previously. The front desk staff was great and helped immensely with all of our travel arrangements and getting around Venice. Thanks to their help, it was a breeze to make good use of our time. The lobby and breakfast room are very nice, clean, inviting and functional. The rooms were simple and clean. If you are looking for a five star accomodation, look somwehere else. If you want a clean functional room to sleep in, while focusing your time and energy on Venice, then this a great hotel to try. Likewise, staying on Lido as opposed to Venice proper was a nice break, and the prices seem to be cheaper on the island than in Venice. Breakfast was simple, good, and prompt. The prompt part is especially critical in Italy, where they don't seem to view time in the same manner.

Reviews.Title: “Best option in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Kfung4
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel with my relatives for one night. This hotel is truely amazing as it has impressed me with its excellent location, staff( thanks Eugenio, you are really kind and professional!). My relative was so touched when Euguenio took out the birthday cake and champagne to celebrate his birthday(I am so pleased as it's his birthday trip so we wanna do something to surprised him and Eugenio has helped us to achieve it!)The room was spacious, however we are not able to see the canal view maybe our room is on the first floor which is a pity. the breakfast was very good. We left the hotel early as there was a boat strike so we cannot make the trip to murano island. But I am sure next time we will come back and stay here for a longer time!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and Friendly with great quality”
Reviews.Author: Sheri1975
Reviews.Content: Loved, it Loved it, Loved it..... Having spoken to a friend who had been to Venice a few months prior to me planning our trip, she advised me of the expense on the Island of Venice itself for poor quality and service. She advised to look on Lido or one of the surrounding Islands...I compared this hotel to others and it seemed to be offering a good rate for a good quality. In particular the breakfast surveys for most hotels are shocking..I have to tell you that my mother and I were not disapointed. On the contrary, Breakfast was lovely. A choice of cereals and juices, yoghurts, granola and fresh fruit are on offer...Bread for toasting and an array of bread roles and crackers....fresh croissants from plain, chocolate or almond and a cold meat selection including cheeses and fresh boiled eggs...all eaten overlooking the lagoon and out onto the tower of St Marks Square. Before we arrived I had lots of correspondence with the hotel and the team there where friendly and very helpful from start to finish. There is a lift which is great when you've been travelling all day with a heavy case and the hotel is directly opposite the vaporetto stop so no lugging your suitcase for miles once you're off. It was great to get the water bus back to the hotel after a long day of sight seeing (Which takes about 10-15 minutes tops) and look back at the picturesque view of venice, and then relax in a quiet, slower paced and less noisy surroundings. About 45 mins to an hour from the airport by waterbus... A really great stay - only one thing that could have improved our stay, the beds were a little hard...this is easily rectified with one of the blankets out of the wardrobe! The team also advised of great restaurants on Lido and help us with lots of bookings for concerts, boat tours and other activities...clean, bright, great service....ideal. Would recommended highly... ****************

Reviews.Title: “Does the Panorama need another glowing review !”
Reviews.Author: SurreyNavigator
Reviews.Content: Just back from another stay at the Panorama. Welcomed like old friends by Eugenio and the rest of the staff. Perfect position and views - read all the other reviews, this hotel will not disappoint you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Venice and airport”
Reviews.Author: eiamjw
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, most with some sort of view of Venice, charming and friendly staff. It's directly next to the landing stage for the boats to Venice and the airport. A roof terrace offers excellent opportunities to photograph Venice with a telephoto lens, and I guess would be very nice in the summer. The airport is one hour away on the Alilaguna boat (â‚¬15). Venice is a few minutes away by water bus, served by lines 1, 51 and 52 (at least).

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: eonaLondon
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice for the first time for our 40th Wedding Anniversary. The hotel is ideally situated, directly opposite the Lido ferry terminal. Quiet, stylish and unpretentious, it proved an excellent base for our visit. The room was comfortable and elegant. A mini bar was provided. The room was quiet and the bed large and comfortable. A full continental breakfast was included, with a stunning view across the lagoon Huge liners glided past as you munched your cereal. All the staff were very helpful and efficient, in particular the receptionists, Eugenio and Franchesca. The Lido is on the edge of the Lagoon a ten minute boat ride from St Marco's. Ferry tickets of various duration can be purchased at the terminal and give you access to all parts of the lagoon. There are shops, restaurants, a beach and pleasant areas to walk within easy reach of the hotel. A haven away from the bustle of central Venice. A bonus is also that you arrive at St Marco's by boat.

Reviews.Title: “Just like returning home!”
Reviews.Author: jojo2064
Reviews.Content: My husband and i returned to Venice for our 1st wedding anniversary. We were married there last year and this was our 3rd stay at the hotel. Please stay here if you are looking for old style excellent service, wonderful views across the lagoon. Eugenio and the staff just cannot do enough for the guests, When we arrived we were greeted like family, with beautiful flowers and a bottle of prosecco in our room, a wonderful start to our anniversary. The hotel is ideal for travelling to all the islands, with the vaparetto station located in front of the hotel. Lido is also ideal to get away from the hustle and bussle of central Venice, lovely to walk alone the tree lined streets to the beach. We hope to return next year to the hotel as it has a special place in our hearts, stay here and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September having stayed in Venice itself in July and found the hotel to be just what we expected. All the staff wer very friendly from the moment we checked in. We booked a superior double because the web site said it would a view across the lagoon towards St Marks square. We were not disappointed as the reality was just that. The room was spacious, well appointed and had everything we wanted. The hotel is near local restaurants, being just a stroll away and with the Vaporetto station being just across the road made getting to the Venice island and Murano/Burano very easy. St Marks sq is just 15 minutes away and the Vaporetto runs every 10 minutes till late at night. We would certainly come back to the Hotel Panorama on our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “We just had to go back - no other choice.”
Reviews.Author: Robin R
Reviews.Content: Why is it called the Panorama? Reserve a room at the front of the hotel and you'll see why. It has the most stunning views across the lagoon, and on some days you can even see the Alps. There is an air of gentle grace about the place that reflects a time before so many hotels became impersonal, concrete and plastic palaces. The staff are gracious, courteous and so helpful - nothing is too much trouble. When we checked in and said we'd stayed there five years before, back came the answer "we know, it is nice to see you again". How good is that!!! The Lido also has the advantage of giving you a break from the hustle and bustle of Venice, and has more than enough to offer for an evening meal and a stroll. We particularly liked going into Venice of an evening and returning late at night across the lagoon by Vaporetto. This hotel is highly recommended - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “a truly warm Italian welcome by smiling faces at Hotel Panorama”
Reviews.Author: bari e
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at almost 2 a.m. the front counter staff (Stefano) accomodated us, he was so kind to help us with our luggage and walked up the stairs himself (a true gentleman). We had a very clean spacious, quiet, and lovely room. After a trip from Paris (which was gross) seeing the Italian hospitality and loveliness of their people was refreshing. During the day, we were helped by (Eugenio) also at the front counter who helped us with places to see in Venice. We recommend this hotel for anyone who likes to enjoy Venice by staying at a clean, comfortable and quiet hotel with excellent staff members, it is just 15 minutes away from the main part of Venice which is easity accessable by the water taxis that run till late hours of the night. A note of caution about Italy in general, don't ever take taxis from anyone who approaches you, they are a rip off and not actual taxi drivers. Taxi drivers are not allowed to do this, so they just wait at the stations for you to go to them, they always have a meter and are honest. ****LOVE ITALY****

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Junior Suite with a view”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Panorama hotel on Lido Island in Venice as part of our Honeymoon for which was an excellent choice with the location it was only a 5 min water bus to the main land and the stop was directly outside the hotel in additon to this they were extremley helpful with explaining venice and they were happy to give recommendations and they provided a great service the only downsides were that we had to check in for our flight home and was charged to use the wifi for which when we are paying a considerable amount for the main room in the hotel we would have expected this to be included and then lastly the bar closed at 9pm, but mainly it was a very good hotel and I would highly recommend to a first time visitor

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Gosia55
Reviews.Content: Booked a superior double room as decided it was worth splashing out for view of the lagoon. Was very disappointed as room was at side of building so only had partial lagoon view from side windows (could see more of people smoking on terrace below). Definitely not worth the money we spent - felt guilty the entire time we were there that had persuaded partner that we should splash out for the romance of it. We stayed in Venice after 7 days in the dolomites and as we had a late flight on way out spent first night in a very good value 3* in dolo jus outside venuce which was equal to if not better at quarter of price. Staff were not particularly helpful when our sat nav took us to ferry terminal that wasn't running and I called to ask for directions. Would have been helpful to be sent driving instructions with booking c

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: KitCatL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in August, booked very late with the hotel direct (cheaper than other websites) and they were still able to provide free parking and a lovely cot for our daughter. We had a double room, it was light and airy, huge bed, plenty of space even with the cot, small tv, clean shower room, everything you needed to sleep comfortably-we didn't spend time in it other than that! Breakfast was continental, nothing exciting but very good for a small European hotel. Terrace looked nice with view over the sea, but we didnt use it. Perfect location at the waterbus terminal for 10min journey to San Marco. (33E per person for 72hrs and toddlers and buggy free). Round corner from main street with restaurants etc and 5-10min walk to beach (worth paying 10E each at the hotel for parasol and loungers (toddlers free again). 2min drive to car ferry from mainland (74E for Audi A4 and 2 adults, toddlers free). Cheaper and more convenient than leaving car at mainland car park. Overall, really great place to stay in Venice, especially with the beach close, more summer holiday than city break. The staff were all very friendly. I'd stay there again if we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service in a quaint island away from the crowd”
Reviews.Author: VioletLawrence
Reviews.Content: Best service you can get in Italy.. Eugenio is very helpful and tries to meet all requests.. from the time before you book the room to the time you check out. Lido is a nice island with cafes and restaurants open till late. Breakfast that comes with the room charge is great too!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it there and would recommend the hotel to friends”
Reviews.Author: poppy01bonnie01
Reviews.Content: The location was great, so easy to get the boat across the lagoon to Venice. Lovely views of the lagoon from bedrooms and breakfast room, and the food was very good and lots of variety. The hotel was clean, bright and the staff friendly and helpful. The sun terrace was a great place to rekax after sightseeing. We certainly would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Most Memorable Holiday”
Reviews.Author: KeithandHolly
Reviews.Content: My partner recently booked a surprise holiday in Venice for my 40th birthday! As it was the height of summer and probably the busiest month to visit Venice, we booked the Hotel on the small island of Lido. What a choice!! The area was clean, quiet and beautiful with a gorgeous beach on one side of the island and the views of Venice on the other. It was just a small water bus or taxi ride away from the streets of Venice. The hotel itself could not have been situated better with perfect views across the Lagoon from both the bedroom and sun terrace. The breakfast was more than plenty with a huge choice of different foods available. The rooms were large and extremely clean. All the staff on Reception where so pleasant and all seems to go out of their way to help and advise with any queries/transport questions etc regarding Venice. As our flight was not until late in the evening and as we needed to be checked out by 12.00noon, the staff were so accomodating looking after our luggage and letting us change at the hotel. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB AND FRIENDLY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: JMK27
Reviews.Content: We spent a week with the Panorama and were happy in every respect. The staff and Eugenio were truly friendly and helpful with every request and suggestion. Our room was lovely and had views of the lagoon and the hotel is steps away from the water buses and taxis. The Lido itself is charming and combines beaches with restaurants and lovely walks. We would return without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “SMALL”
Reviews.Author: Magazinedude
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on the 29th of may and were shown to a room facing the " Garden" . In other words where the cars park? The room was so small we had to basically empty our suitcases and deal with it. Also the shower never would drain properly ( We told the front Desk Twice ) The location is on Lido Island so you will have to ferry each day to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top service!”
Reviews.Author: LisandMark618
Reviews.Content: From start to finish this was a great Stay. I can't say enough about the professional staff. Even the manager gets involved. They jumped all over a minor issue we had to solve it without hesitation and far beyond expectations! Lido is a great clean family friendly area just a short ferry ride from bustling Venice. A good breakfast and a private beach was part of the price too. Book early to get the best room. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “So Lovely”
Reviews.Author: AislingL_11
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, in a lovely location, convenient to beach and vaparetto, and very short journey to St. Marks Square, about 15 mins. Staying here gives you the best of all worlds, a beach and sightseeing holiday in one. Very friendly and helpful staff, very clean rooms, lovely breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, solid amenities”
Reviews.Author: Phios
Reviews.Content: Hotel is about 15 steps from the water taxi station and has excellent views of Venice in all her splendid glory. You don't need to struggle through 5 million tourists to get around the hotel either, because it is located on Lido, which is about 10 minutes from the Piazza via waterway. An added benefit is that you can drive here from the mainland via the ferry, so there is no luggage issues (drive right up and drop off). Tour director brought us here and it was well worth the cost. The room is decently sized with good internet access (10 EU for 24 hours of access), soft bed, and clean bathroom. The AC doesn't work all that well, so be prepared to open windows at night to cool the room down. Breakfast is included in the bill, but is of the cold variety, so don't expect much.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: 187870Caroline
Reviews.Content: We had already been in touch ,on line with the very nice Manager Eugenio, before our trip, who was so helpful and saw to everything that we had requested . On our arrival ,he greeted us at the door and made us feel at home from the beginning and continued to be just as helpful all through our holiday giving us very clear directions on how to travel to all the different places in Venice. Our room was very tastefully decorated and very comfortable and very very clean with a wonderful view. We looked over towards the Piazzo San Marca and the other islands plus on a clear day the mountain ranges. On the same floor as our room we had a terrace with table and chairs and very fragant flowers where we could enjoy a superb continental breakfast with lots of choices and watch the world go by. On the hot sunny days we enjoyed using the facilities of the private beach and the hotel's towels. The restaurants at the Lido are very friendly with superb food.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of Venice”
Reviews.Author: JGR33
Reviews.Content: We loved staying on the beach Island of Lido. It was away from the huslte of the main tourist area and the 6 cruise ships docked in Venice! The front door of the hotel is just across from the boat "bus" system to Venice. It is a short, beautiful ride to the tourist area. Our room was older but comfortable. There were few unused electrical outlets to charge our phones (due to them being used for SKY TV). The wifi is NOT included in the price of the room but is available. We had a wonderful view of Venice from our room window. The bathroom was clean. The front desk was always helpful with questions about schedules etc. We enjoyed the roof deck. It too looked out onto Venice. The breakfast was nice; tea, coffee, juice, cereal, yogurt, meat, cheeses, pasteries hard boiled eggs, toast etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Angor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a in a wonderful spot that was away from the hustle and bustle, but still very convenient to the center of Venice. Great views, and it has the best location, as it is right across the street from where the boats land. There was a unanticipated 24 hour public transportation strike occurring during part of our stay, and the staff at the Panorama were so helpful and thoughtful that we managed to have a n excellent stay and were spared from any inconvenience due to their knowledge of the area and transportation alternatives. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: erie477
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Panorama when visiting Venice in May 2011 and we just loved our stay! Eugenio, the hotel manager was extremely courteous and helpful from day 1. The hotel is very cute and sits just a short boat ride from the main island of Venice. The room was small, but functional. All staff were very nice and friendly. The Breakfast was good as well. The hotel is on the island of Lido, which also has a lot to offer. The island has several restaurants, a beach, and shopping. The main island of Venice is extremely fast and easy to get to. The hotel is conveniently located right across from the boat station. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel. Top Notch Staff. Incredible Views.”
Reviews.Author: kdjc
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the fact that there was a safe and a hair dryer in the room and that breakfast was included. When I booked I didn't realize that the hotel was on the Island of Lido to the east of Venice proper. I was kind of nervous about this because I was thinking that we would want to be in the city center instead of on the outside. I was so wrong! Lido is just a 15 minute vaporetto ride to St. Mark's, and the vaporetto stop is right outside the hotel, so getting anywhere is very easy. The hotel is a short walk to the BEACH. Yes, the BEACH. We walked down on our first day and had rum drinks, with our feet in the sand. It was a nice way to end our ten days in Italy. The staff, particularly Nicolo, were wonderful, suggesting places for us to eat, and keeping us updated on the vaporetto schedule, as well as the Alilaguna boat to get to the airport very early in the morning. One highlight of this hotel...the terrace. We had cappuccino and pastries on it in the afternoon, with gorgeous views of Venice. This hotel is a gem, and I would go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Panorama - the perfect base from which to explore the Venice Lido”
Reviews.Author: Robin_Saikia
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Panorama overlooks Venice on the west side of the Lido, very near the vaporetto station and the main street of the Lido, the Gran Viale S Maria Elisabetta. The hospitality manager, Eugenio Nardin, is at the top of his profession and one of the most charming front-of-house personalities in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Optimum Venice/Lido location”
Reviews.Author: ualift
Reviews.Content: We requested lagoon side room and planned to park car. From communications to honoring our requests, everything was great. Lido was a great place to break from the heart of Venice activity for the night with great dining, shopping activity on nearby street Gran Viale. The vaporetto stop adjacent to hotel was extremely convenient. Some street noise, but with windows closed for sleep, not a negative. Panorama staff very pleasant and accomodating. Well furnished, decorated room. With window/doors open to balcony overlooking lagoon/Venice, it was ideal. Beautiful area, excellent hotel. We'd do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel with a beautiful panorama”
Reviews.Author: ciprianjitaru_jitaru
Reviews.Content: I was in Venice from 7 to 10 of may 2011 and I choose hotel Panorama Venice. PLUSES: 1. Located on Lido island is providing a peaceful and quiet enviroment away from the tourists crowds in Venice. Still only 20 minutes away by vaporeto to San Marco square ( vaporeto are comming every 10-20 minutes) Number 1 vaporeto is stopping at every station but there are much faster ones like 52 which are stopping only at main stations 2. Hotel is very clean an recentlly renovated. 3.Is located just accros the vaporeto station so you won't have to drag your luggage trough long narrow streets like in Venice. 4.Price /quality ratio is ok 5.Staff is polite and helpfull. Minuses: 1. Breakfast is not very diversified ( no warm food at all -like scrambeld eggs or ham) 2. Rooms are rather small but this is normal in Venice. 3.Beds are ( as in most of the hotels today) not made for people over 1.80 meters , so if you are taller the 1.80 meters expect to sleep with your feets hanging from the bed. 4.After booking trough venere.com the accomodation in this hotel I find out that on the hotel site it was an offer for birthday holiday (it was the case for my wife) including special price and â€¢A bottle of Prosecco served in room â€¢Rose petals lying on the bed â€¢a special birthday cake I would expect them to make a nice gesture and to offer those facilities even if I wasn't aware of them when I made the booking on venere.com ( the special offers are not available on booking site)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Panorama was the Hotel for us!”
Reviews.Author: GabyDublin
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4-night stay with my husband and a friend in the Hotel Panorama. I strongly endorse all the positive comments about the hotel. Eugenio and all the other staff were helpful and pleasant - always with a ready smile and a friendly, good-humoured exchange of banter. They made excellent recommendations for restaurants within easy walking distance for dinner each evening (we particularly enjoyed La Favorita). The rooms were spotless and carefully serviced each day and it was a nice touch that someone came in and closed the shutters for us before our return each evening. The hotel was extremely quiet at nights and we slept very soundly - not surprising, given our boatrides, gallery visits, opera performance, etc!!! It was not a problem that the hotel was on Lido island rather than nearer St. Mark's. The vaporetta stop is so convenient and it is very advisable and economical to organise a 3-day travel ticket online with venice-connected in advance. Breakfast was plentiful, with fresh strawberries and other fruit, in addition to a range of breads, cheeses, ham, hardboiled eggs,youghurts and cereals. The breakfast room was overseen by a young waitress who anticipated what was needed and refreshed supplies quickly and efficiently. I recommend Hotel Panorama unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for friendly service”
Reviews.Author: bredbored
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Venice and the Panorama stands out for TripAdvisor ratings and value. Whilst not on the main Venetian island, the hotel is next to the main water bus stop on the Lido island and is therefore well serviced by both vaporetto (for local hopping around the city) and Alilaguna (e.g. Airport transfer and inter island travel). All the staff were pleasant, helpful and courteous despite my mangling of their language; all the front desk staff had excellent English and I heard fluent sounding German and French too. Our standard room (301) was very clean, quiet, of a decent size and had the usual facilities; a marble tiled bathroom was a surprise though the jacuzzi bath was starting to look a bit past it's best. Breakfast is of the buffet type we expected and modest in quality. Overall the Panorama well deserves the praise of the other reviewers and I consider it to be great value and well worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Just great.”
Reviews.Author: cabbage1018
Reviews.Content: After a hectic day amongst the crowds in Venice, a short water taxi ride to the peaceful Isle of Lido and the Hotel Panorama is just what every visitor needs. Directly across the street from the water taxi and around the corner from the shops and restaurants of Lido, the Hotel Panorama is perfectly located. Clean, with comfortable beds, spacious rooms and bathrooms, free parking, tremendous breakfast, and a welcoming staff. Maybe a little pricey for some, but well worth it to me and my family. Venice can get a little crazy at times, but Lido is an oasis of calmness. I highly recommend Hotel Panorama.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to enjoy Venice”
Reviews.Author: itchy-feet2008
Reviews.Content: Situated at the water bus stop making it extremely easy to get to Venice and to and from the airport. Room was large, clean and comfortable with a nice en suite bathroom. Breakfast was the usual continental spread of cereals, breads, meat and cheese....more than adequate to keep you full for a day spent walking around Venice. This is a four star hotel and the location of it is what makes it a winner. The lido on which it is situated is lovely and a nice break from the busy touristy Venice. I'd recommend hiring bikes and cycling round, it's very pretty. The beach is a short walk from the hotel and is clean with a nice cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: vlb1979
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Hotel Panorama, Lido. Cheaper than central Venice but offers much more for your money. Stayed in the Junior Suite which had the most amazing view over the Venice Lagoon to St Marks Square and the Grand Canal. The room was very clean and spacious. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Enjoyed the unseasonably warm weather and loved sitting on the first floor terrace drinking beer from the bar overlooking Venice. Just perfect!!!!! Would highly recommend as right next to the waterstop and only 15 minutes boat ride from central Venice!

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE TO MINGLE WITH THE LOCALS”
Reviews.Author: IceQueen2013
Reviews.Content: If you wish to travel and feel like you are with locals and not with fellow tourists as much, this is the best place to stay. About 15 mins to the city center, which I take is San Marco square. The locals live here, and if you love jewelry and all things shiny and sparkly, Murano island, home of Murano glass is just 2-3 stops away by water bus. Our room is small for 2 people, but I heard that is typical of European hotels anyway. But we had a beautiful wide view of the town, and the sun comes in during daytime. There is a church nearby if you're into that and it is packed with locals on Sundays for mass. Down the street, they also have relics of garrison/forts during WW I or II, one of the few surviving ones in Italy. Services in the hotel is very personalized. Also, the post office is just around the corner. It is a long enough island for a good morning or afternoon run. BTW, the bathroom, although smaller than American standard is elegant, styled in old world Europe... very chic and with a view of the town through a full window/door. I thought that was funny.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Beside the waterbus station. Beware of the safe.”
Reviews.Author: rodoherty1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the island of Lido which is about 15mins from the main Venice square via waterbus. We were initially offered a ground-floor room beside the breakfast room and near reception which had no view at all. We were offered an upgrade to a first-floor room with a stunning view for â‚¬15 per night. The staff were friendly and spoke excellent English and the breakfast was a typical European breakfast (meats, juices, cereal, bread-rolls and coffee) ... tasty! But beware of the safe in the room. It locks with a standard (easily duplicated) key and the key-barrel slips right out into your hand when you fully turn the key. We asked a receptionist about this and he said that this is a safety-feature ... so that the safe is permanently locked until you replace the key-barrel ... Not true ... I easily lifted the safedoor-latch with a pen and the door swung open. Needless to say, we lost all confidence the safe and chose not to use it. Overall, it's a very nice hotel if you can get a room with a view. It is right-beside the waterbus-station which costs â‚¬6.50 for a 60min ticket and Venice square is only 15 mins away. Also, Lido is nothing like as touristy or expensive as the main Island which is a big, big thumbs up! And the beach is a 15min walk from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views and amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: Fianna37
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to the top floor suite on our honeymoon. I'd never expected skylights and a full view of all the islands of Venice! Close to the water bus and yet far enough away that you don't hear all the dock noise. This place was charming and quaint, perfect for a getaway from the hustle and bustle of tours on Venice. The staff were polite and truly helpful. Still amazed at how many languages they speak fluently and handled every request and question with grace. The only draw back we had was there was no stand up shower, only a tub and a stool to sit on to shower with. The sloped ceiling of being in an attic made it difficult to bathe, but we made do.

Reviews.Title: “A really friendly comfortable hotel with five star service”
Reviews.Author: disgruntled06
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Panorama surpassed my expectations - it was so convenient - just across the road from the water bus stop. It was also a complete contrast to Venice itself, being quiet and peaceful. I booked a hotel on the Lido on recommendation as the hotels in Venice itself tend to be overpriced and the rooms very small. Our double standard room had a partial view of the lagoon and was clean and comfortable. The breakfasts were generous with plenty of ham, cheese and eggs, pastries, assorted cereals, fruit, juices, etc. Thankyou to Francesca and Eugenio on the desk for their patience - they were so helpful with their advice and directions and even booked a table for us in a restaurant in Venice. We walked across the Lido to the beach when we arrived, a mere 10 minute walk - and hardly anyone around. The trip into Venice every morning by waterbus was a refreshing treat, and the journey home at night a pleasure as we watched all the palaces lit up by chandeliers. Venice is a magical place and to see the city skyline from the Lido every morning was a real delight - in fog or sun, it is simply stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carnd0g
Reviews.Content: Everything we expected and more! We booked this hotel after reading good reviews on this site and were very happy! We booked a standard room but were upgraded free of charge to an attic room! The welcome and service from the reception staff was exceptional throughout the stay (4 nights) especially from Alvise who really tried hard to help us ship our snowboard bag home to Australia! It was really nice to be able to escape the madness of the centre in the evening and relax in the more chilled out environment of Lido. The only fault in our room was that due to the raked ceilings and position of the shower you needed to be really short to stand up, this just meant more romantic baths in the jacuzzi bath! Thats the reason for only 3 stars on room. Overall a really great experience!

Reviews.Title: “The only place worth staying”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi110610
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip back again to Venice and once again we stayed with the Hotel Panorama. We love this place an dthe staff especially Eugenio!!! As always the staff was very helpful especially for making reservations---UTILIZE them !!! Prior to leaving home I had a very frustrating time trying to make a reservation for a restaurant on Burano...afetr several emails I then contacted the hotel and asked if they could help...no problem!!! They contacted the restaurant and offered us several choices for dining. We also could have gotten our opera tickets there as well!! I have seen some disgruntled Tripadvisor reviews about this hotel and tell you they are false. The hotel staff is equal to any 4 or 5 star concierge department..simply ask and they will take care of everything and yes of course there are some language issues as could be expected visiting ANY country whose native language is not English......if you want English stay in English speaking countries!!! Italy is a country where we have found that not everyone you meet may speak your language well but here they attempt to please your heart and make your vacation a relaxing experience. Our room was clean and warm and comfortable. The breakfast was good and the barista even made a tray for my fiance to bring up to me one morning when I just could not make it out of bed. The hotel is great because you can be away from the touristy sopts and see how the people live. It si definitely LA DOLVE VITA

Reviews.Title: “20th Anniversary Trip-2010”
Reviews.Author: Likequiettraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Venice as part of our 20th wedding anniversary trip to Italy. We stayed at the hotel for two nights Oct 19-20. The hotel was charmingly designed and everything was very clean. We had breakfast at the hotel each morning - it was simple but very tasty. We had a side-facing second story room which was very quiet, despite the fact that it faced the street running alongside the hotel. We had a great view from our small balcony and the staff was indeed friendly and spoke very good English. I have to mention that we had an excellent dinner at a restaurant on the island called Ristorante Favorita which was recommended by the front desk. (Get the suckling pig!!!). At my request, the hotel arranged flowers to be in our room upon our arrival. I must say I was very impressed with the arrangement. I arranged everything via email with them and it was perfect. The flowers were placed in a richly colored Murano glass vase (which we did not get to keep because Murano glass is very expensive). Lido Island is quaint, easy to walk, and best of all you feel very safe walking around with your loved ones. The hotel is even with in walking distance of a beach. You canâ€™t go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our own little Island of Lido, 15 minutes from Venice and Murano by waterferry”
Reviews.Author: Callmecupc8ke
Reviews.Content: Hotel Panorama was located in Lido, Italy about 15 minutes from all the main sites in Venice and Murano Island areas. However, it was pretty cool staying away from all the hustle and bustle. Lido is a town of its own and about 80% locals. Not very tourisy, and not much siteseeing. The waterbus stopped right in front of our hotel which was nice. A few steps away and you are on your way to hop on the local waterbus and exlpore all the sites on the map (Murano Island/Venice). The hotel was nice, not spectacular but unique. A little noisy since the waterbus stops right near the hotel. Breakfast was A+++! Nearby restaurants were ok. We went in mid September and it was chilly, definitely need some warm layers/coat. I just brought one fleece jacket....not the best way to pack. The only negative thing i would have to say is location. It was cool to stay where the locals are, but it seemed far on the waterbus touring around. Plus it was cold. Also, the worst part was getting to the airport to leave Venice, it took about close to an hour. Best part of our stay at Panorama was that they offer FREE taxi to the island of Murano. Free glassblowing demonstration. You can buy more affordable stuff after the demonstrations, there are tons of cool stores to buy nice glass at reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Anil_agarwal01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for my honeymoon during the New Year period. The location of the Hotel is superb. It's away from mainland Venice but not more than 10-15 mins away with very good frequency of water boats. Lido is a wonderful place, away from the buzz of the mainland but not too far. The Bluemoon beach in Lido is very serene and romantic. The room was comfortable and cosy with additional portable heater which was very useful. The staff was good and they helped me with all the queries I had regarding getting my way around the city. There is no restaurant in the hotel which could be a pain at times though breakfast is served in the morning in the cafeteria. There is no internet facility along with the room. It needs to be bought separately.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: AJM_13
Reviews.Content: Having visited Venice twice before, I stayed once on the mainland (Mestre) and once on the main island . This third time, staying on Lido proved the best choice. The hotel is a 1-minute walk from the Lido vaporetto station, which runs very frequent boats to the bus/train station and to San Marco and the Grand Canal. It is easy to find, visible as you approach Lido, and the views across to the main islands is breathtaking. A beautiful building, nicely decorated and comfortable rooms with lots of amenities, great shower (if a little small) and very comfortable beds. The desk staff were very friendly and helpful, and the breakfasts (included in our room rate) fresh, filling and offering lots of variety (the girl behind the bar also makes cappuccinos and other coffees to order if you don't want to use the automatic machine - and you're in Italy, why would you?) You can get a lot more for your money on Lido than on the main island, yet it is just as convenient and just as true a 'Venetian experience' - perhaps moreso, as we often travelled with locals and commuters rather than hoards of other tourists. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “PANORAMA VERY BAD DON'T BOTHER”
Reviews.Author: QueenieLady32
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were met by not a very friendly male receptionist, and when we got into the lift said cripes he's not very friendly. Our room was small but overall fine, shame there wasn't a bath in there as ladies need a bath. The room was stinking hot but I managed to work out the temperature on my own as I didn't want to ask the Mr Grumpies at reception. The room had Sky TV, not that that was of any use to us as there was only 1 English channel BBC World Newsâ€¦â€¦.EVERY hotel I have stayed in all over the World has always had at least Nat Geo and Discovery. The breakfast was the most disgusting experience I have ever had to endure, and I travel overseas (long haul) at least 3 times per year. This hotel does not have a kitchen nor restaurant. Breakfast consisted of cereal, yogurt, stinking ham (that made me retch from the smell), toast and raw, uncooked cold eggsâ€¦.Do they not realise that raw eggs can cause salmonella poisoning!!! And they charge Â£10 for thisâ€¦.You can get a full English breakfast HOT for the same price all over the world!!! For the whole of the time at this hotel we were made to feel very unwelcome, like we were disturbing their Christmas and new year holidayâ€¦.we didn't complain but were heard quite a few vocal guests complaining about all sorts and I don't blame them. The staff come across as if they are running a special hotel in a special place, they could not be more wrong. The 7 Star hotel in Dubai is special, hotels in Bali, Australia, Fiji, USA, Dom Rep, Thailand are special this hotel is an over priced, over rated tacky bed and breakfast, if you can call it breakfastâ€¦.the homeless eat better on the streets of London! I had read the reviews of this hotel and thought that we had chosen a good hotel, all I can say is the other reviews must have been written by people that have very low expectations of a hotel and I for one would NEVER recommend this hotel. We have NEVER in all our experience of overseas (long haul) travel been soooo happy to check out of a hotel and leave a country.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: brenfarrel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed her in late November and could not have been happier about our choice to stay on Lido. The hotel is conveniently located near the water taxi stop and the rooms are clean and comfortable. The real standout of the whole experience was the remarkable staff. Eugenio and his whole tema went above and bveyond in accomodating our requests for information and in assisting us in reservations. Would absolutely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Visit, great location”
Reviews.Author: BoboTexas
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews for this hotel and booked our reservation based on the reviews we read. We took the water taxi from the airport to the Hotel which takes about an hour, costs 13 euros one way. This is the only way to get to the hotel as Lido is an island across from the main part of Venice. We arrived at the hotel in the AM, and were allowed to check into our room early which was great as we had flown all night. This hotel is one block from the Water Taxi pier, and is the most visible hotel when arriving in Lido, which is a major benefit conpared to persons trying to find their hotels in Venice. When going onto the main part of Vinice, you will see people with maps, addresses of their hotels still gazing around trying to find out where the hotel is. The Panorama even though in Lido, is a wonderful location. Don't be concerned about getting around Venice, as the water taxis are the best and cheapest way to get around. Be sure that you board the water taxis that are routed vs the independent ones that take you anywhere, but for a much higher price. Just to clarify, the water taxis carry up to 100 people and are like buses in most cities, the Independents are like cabs. As for Lido, the hotel is right next to the main street which has shopping and dining and next to the bus stops to go around Lido which takes only an hour at most. The hotel was a very good buy for the money we paid. The rooms were very clean, everything worked, the breakfast was great, with Stella serving and insuring that all the food was fresh. She was very proficient in handing the food service by herself. Sabrina ran the fornt desk, advised us on everything from how to get the bus, the cheapest way to travel by buying 2 day passes from the water taxi, to where to eat dinner. If we were to return to Venice, I would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at Lido”
Reviews.Author: Victor197
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel, placed at Lido Island, closed to Lido Vaporetto-stop, from which it is possible to reach Santa Lucia main railway station in 45 minutes, and San Marco in 20 minutes (day and night connections). Room is elegant and comfortable, and sights to the Venice Laguna are good, although a new Vaporetto-stop is being built just in front of the hotel. Second floor is therefore recommended, as in the first one sights are not so good. Breakfast is basic, not very varied for a 4-stars hotel, and internet connection is not free. Price is good in comparison with other hotels in Venice, but Venice itself is not a cheap city. Probably I would come back to this hotel, and I would recommend it for any visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Panorama is panoramic - and with a great service”
Reviews.Author: LarsDane
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 4 nights with our two children. Since we were on a small road trip round northern Italy, Lido is the place, since you can bring your car along. The Hotel is spotlessly clean and the service and welcoming you receive when arriving leaves you elevated for several days. We got a room on the third floor with a double bed and two sofa beds, where you could overlook the lagoon all the way to St. Marks, when standing two steps. Fantastic view, we stood there every afternoon, enjoying a glass of wine, when we were back from Venice, having a siesta. The main Vaporetto terminal is just a one minute walk away, so we could easily get back and forth between Venice and Lido - which meant that we even could go to Venice in the evening for dinner - together with the kids - since we were never far away from a Vaporetto stop. The Main shopping street on Lido (Gran Viale Santa Maria Elisabetta) is just close, here were restaurants, shops and cafÃ©s. There are an - extremely small - parking facility at the hotel - they asked kindly if they should park the car - I would recommend that you let them do it - there can be squeezed 3-4 cars in there, but then be sure that you have all your gear in your room, and don't need anything from the car, it will be impossible to get to. Breakfast was fine and you could get special coffees if you wanted to. Everything was very nice here - especially the service, which made us feel welcome from the very beginning and during the whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Venice - loved the hotel, location and staff!!”
Reviews.Author: kathymcc
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for two weeks at this hotel while taking a photography class. The view of Venice every morning (from my balcony!) was wonderful, and the location right off the vaporetto was perfect. I didn't have to lug my bags very far, and found it quieter and more fun to be a step away. I know the Grand Canal sounds romantic, but I know I wouldn't have slept as well with the noise. That said, there was construction right outside the hotel, but it was quiet at night and fun to watch the Italian crew work during the day! Another guest had trouble opening and closing her shutters, so ask for help - they lock open and closed! There is a restaurant right next door that is delicious (try the seafood zuppa). Breakfast at the hotel is well stocked - Stella is very friendly and will make fresh cappuccino if you ask! Sabrina and Eugenio are a big help at the front desk during the day - a wealth of information, and I always felt safe with Francesco and Nicola at night. The Wifi was very cheap - 10 euro for 24 hours lasted me two weeks as long as I logged out! Roomy bathroom - standard size room. I want to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome people!!!”
Reviews.Author: mallie47
Reviews.Content: I highly recomend this hotel on lido in venice. Nice quiet place to go after the hustle and bustle of Venice. Very quiet neighborhood, beautifull streets and the staff were very nice and accomadating which was soo nice after having spent time in Rome where you are lucky to get anyone to help you. If i ever go back to Venice i would not stay anywhere else.THANKS HOTEL PANORAMA FOR MAKING OUR VISIT SO PLEASANT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend you stay anywhere else than the Hotel Panorama”
Reviews.Author: tellitasitisWales
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a long weekend in Venice where I took my husband for an anniversary treat. It is the most romantic place and as someone who doesn't always write reviews i felt I had to let others know how we found the hotel. I had checked TA before booking and kept coming back to this hotel. It is ideally situated, the staff are fantastic, especially Eugenio who you will see during the day. We did upgrade rooms when we got there as I could not have stayed without seeing the views of the lagoon. Breakfast is what it is a cold buffet, great chocolate croissants, tea and as much toast/cereal as you like and again the views from the dining room mesmerise. If you fancy having a bit of fun hire a double bike from the shop just behind the hotel, took a lovely gentle 2 hour ride round the island and saw the beach albeit closed. The vaporetto is just across the road and took 10 mins over to Venice, you can then walk ito the centre which is flat and takes about 10 minutes, otherwise stay on it and get off at St Marks.Would I go back to this hotel is always a question I ask myself and it is a definate yes for the Hotel Panorama.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndyH37
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in October 2010. Location is excellent as it's 30 seconds from the waterbus stop at the Lido so cheaper than staying in the centre of Venice. Room was clean, we had a superior room overlooking the lagoon so the view was looking over at Venice from the room. They are working on the waterbus stop outside the hotel at present which was the only drawback as work started at around 7.30 to 8 each morning but this didn't detract from our stay as we were up around that time anyway. No bath, only a shower which wasn't huge (I'm 6' 2" so I like big showers!!). But it did the job and was quiet at night with the shutters closed. Breakfast was excellent, continental style with a choice of bread, yoghurts, pastries, fruit, criossants, tea, coffee etc. The staff are helpful and advised about which waterbus to catch etc and advised the best time to catch the Alilaguna back to the airport and you can leave your bags there if your flight isn't until later. No 1 waterbus is every 10mins across to the main part of Venice and you can get a waterbus back at any time to the Lido although obviously less frequent the later you are. Plenty of places to eat on the Lido too if you want to come back near the hotel for dinner. Would definitely recommend this hotel or stay here again if I was lucky enough to go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JidThorax
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early October, soon after the beach and film festival seasons had ended. The hotel is a modestly sized building, like most in Venice, although the neighborhood has quite a different feel, being on the Lido. Absolutely no complaints about our stay--the room was clean, comfortable and as it was a (recommended) junior suite, spacious. The included breakfast was limited, but quite good. Venice is an expensive place to stay, and the Panorama is not inexpensive. Yet it is a good value compared to similar hotels in the central area. The trade-off is having to take the vaporetto every day, but aside from it being a boat, it's not much different than taking a bus in other cities. Moreover, the Panorama is located within a block of a major vaporetto terminal, which makes getting to the city and the airport--and moving luggage--exceptionally easy. Hotels of similar quality with that degree of accessibility in central Venice are much more expensive, so on balance the Panorama is a good value. I would definitely stay at the Panorama again, and I absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here as part of a wedding party...”
Reviews.Author: njmudd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a wedding party. Staff were the best I've come across in any hotel. Comfortable, excellent location, and as I say the best staff. Will certainly return to Venice & I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: berylgrieve
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 2 day stay in room overlooking canal (lagoon) before we went on a Med cruise leaving from Venice. Caught the waterbus from Airport that took us right to the Hotel. Walking distance to shops, beach & restaurants. We bought 1 day ticket for waterbus and toured by water all around Venice. The Staff were very friendly and helpful and the buffet continental breakfast was excellant with lots of choice. Hotel arranged a water taxi to take us to our cruise ship. Hope to have a return visit for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice of venue, close to Venice via the No. 1 Water Bus”
Reviews.Author: MTET96
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located 2 mins from the "Lido" Water Bus stop. Very friendly staff, who provided first class service, catering for all our needs, during a 4 night stay. Breakfast was average, but clean, efficient & never a problem getting a table. We stayed on second floor in corner room 204 which had 3 windows overlooking the lagoon with an superb view of the Venice skyline & the Cruise ships which crawled in & out of the channels nearby hotel. Whilst the street traffic is close by, general noise level decreased after 2200 hours. Overall, we rated the Panorama as ticking most of our boxes & would not hesitate to recommend to friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous little hotel with a fantastic view of mainland Venice”
Reviews.Author: MoleyMiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, with excellent staff. We were given VIP treatment when we arrived, and lots of little touches to make our 10th Anniversary celebration extra special. There was quite a bit of noise from traffic, but it didn't spoil it for us. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: flychi
Reviews.Content: Great surprise that the location of the hotel was so close to the water bus stop. Literally pulled our bags across the street to the hotel door. The staff was great and the room was nice. I read in a earlier view that junior suite is that only way to go. I must agree. the junior suite featured a balcony overlooking the bay. Only downside was the construction going on outside. Bed was somewhat comfortable and room was somewhat smaill for a suite but still suitable. HIs and her sinks came in handy. Shower was a bit smail. Breakfast was OK. I didnt like the lack of outlets though and the fact that we had to turn our card back in to the desk every time we left. Eugenio was a gracious host. Overall enjoyed my stay. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ZurabNikolava
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel for those who wants to combine beach rest and survey of Venice and Islands...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelnickie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great- we loved it. The room was big and clean with a very large and modern bathroom. We had an attic room for a family and found it very comfortable. The breakfast was great , the staff was helpful and professional, the location was perfect. We very much enjoyed our stay here before our cruise. Highly recommend it. If we are ever back in Venice , we would w/o a doubt stay there again- next time longer.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very professional staff”
Reviews.Author: Keentraveller004
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Venice in the last five years and the first time that we have stayed at the Lido. We chose Hotel Panorama because of its conveneient location very close to the vaporetto. This made it very easy for us to visit the islands in the lagoon - in particular Torcello which is a mystical place! We used the Hotel Panorama beach access several times and it made visiting the beach very easy for us. A good 10 - 15 minutes walk away from the hotel but plenty of space when you get there. I would recommend this hotel: it is clean and comfortable; a good continental breakfast; very helpful staff and a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! I wanna go back soon.”
Reviews.Author: xsil
Reviews.Content: I went there in Nov 2008. I loved my trip to Venice and this hotel was the best I stayed in Italy. It is very well decorated, clean, the staff is very helpful. The location is very convenient, right across from the vaporetto to Venice. If I had stayed at a more expensive hotel in Venice (and probably not as comfortable), I would have missed all the fun in Lido.
