Nice neighborhood too, a lot of shops and restaurants nearby and much cheaper than Venice. The breakfast was excellent, and they even had satellite TV with all the main US channels. So much fun riding the vaporetto, this is the way to go around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quiet hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: plaxtonman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during April 2010 in one of the deluxe rooms and really can't praise the hotel highly enough. The bedroom was excellent, clean and spacious with a view direct across the lagoon to Venice main island. Staff were without exception excellent and helpful with tips on local sights, restaurants etc (of which there are many on the Lido). One of the best things about the hotel is its tranquility - the main island can be quite intense and to be able to take a ten minute boat journey back to the hotel where it is quiet and calm but you can still see the island was invaluable. Right at the end of our stay the ash cloud descended and we were trapped. Here the staff of the Panorama came into their own first rebooking us without fuss, then with help and advice. On the day we left we had a long train journey ahead of us (to Munich) and they furnished us with enough delicious food from the breakfast room to keep us going for the whole day. We'll be back, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: theshephards
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel purely on Trip Advisor reviews and we were not disappointedl. Many comments refer to a poor breakfast, but ignore them, there was lots to choose and all fresh each morning. Our room was very spacious and clean, with an amazing view over the lagoon. We spent some evenings on the terrace watching the sun go down! And travelled back into venice in the evenings to enjoy the orchestras in St Marks square. It was nice to stay on Lido and to leave the hustle and bustle of Venice behind when weary from sightseeing and the heat in July. The vaporetto takes only 15mins from san marco to lido and stops only a 100m or so from the hotel. The beach is good and only a short walk from the hotel about 20mins. The vaperetto is a great way to travel into venice and to do this each morning into san marco was great. i recommend to anyone, if you want to go on a gondola, do it late in the evening (me and my husband went on one at 11pm) it was the most amazing thing we have ever done, it was like having the city to ourselves expensive (100 Euros) but well worth it! Overall the hotel was excellent, the staff were helpful and Lido is a great base to enjoy venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good service - breakfast poor”
Reviews.Author: PK2010_10
Reviews.Content: All in all we enjoyed our stay at the Panorama, but cam away with a couple of gripes. Firstly, the quality of the breakfast was poor. The fruit juice was cordial as opposed to fresh and the breakfast rolls were a little stale and dry. The choice was poor and very uninspiring. The biggest disappointment was the quality of the coffee - we were expecting better from an italian hotel. The service was good and the staff friendly - although on one occasion we asked the man at the front of house to recommend a good local restaurant and he just handed us a card without asking us what we wanted - when we went to the restaurant he recommended it was substandard. Our room was comfortable and the air conditioning just about mustered an acceptable temperature although still a little warm for me. The room was clean but we weren't keen on the jacuzzi bath - it was very noisy - sounded like a pneumatic drill. The hotel boasts a terrace and it is an option for guests to have their breakfast on the terrace but this isn't widely publicised so few guests do. When we took up this option it was a bit special as the view across the lagoon was great.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back :)”
Reviews.Author: marimur
Reviews.Content: Extremly friendly, kind and helpful staff. Good breakfast in a nice room with a lagune view. The rooms are clean and comfortable. (But avoid the top floor if you have paid for a lagune view - you have to climb a small staircase to look out of the window...) The vaporetto - water bus - is docking directly across the street from the hotel. There are plenty of shops and restaurants in the area, and the heart of Venice is just a short vaporetto-ride away. On the other side of Lido - a short walk across - there are excellent beaches, both public and private (hotel Panorama has a private beach).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect refuge.”
Reviews.Author: IZZE
Reviews.Content: This place is a terrific place to stay in Venice, especially if travelling with kids. The staff was wonderful and the location is ideal. It is right across from the vaporetto station, and you can be in San Marco in just five minutes. Our room had a beatiful view of the city! Since we were travelling with kids, we wanted a place away from the crowds in the heart of the city. The private beach is a five minute walk across the island, and it was an execellent way for us to recuperate from the jet lag on our first day. The staff were very friendly, offering us excellent suggestions on restaurants, getting around, and helpful tips on making our stay enjoyable. The lobby has some beautiful Murano glass pieces on display, and breakfast was quite good. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel on the Lido was great after a hectic day in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: wombat04
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Panorama Hotel on the Venice Lido. It is ideally situated right opposite the vaporetti stop and close to the main street with a good choice of evening dinning. We had a superior room overlooking the Lagoon with Piazza San Marco in the distance. There is a roof terrace to enjoy the Canaletto like views of Venice. The rooms are small but well appointed and very clean. Windows are double glazed so no noise and have shutters if you need to block out the light. It is a good option to stay on the Lido if you like a more relaxed, beach atmosphere. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views, excellent service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: pal_111
Reviews.Content: If you want an ideally situated hotel to base your visit to the Venice area, this is it. The bus stops and boat station is right outside, and if you close the window you cannot hear any noise either. We had a lovely room with 4 windows, inc 2 balconies, all with a view of the Laguna. The service was very good, staff very pleasant and helpful, and the room was clean and modern with the usual facilities like freeview, shower, air-con, fridge, phone, wi-fi etc. Also note, this hotel is only a 10 minute walk from the FREE public beach!

Reviews.Title: “Why isn't this hotel in the Top 10”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Junkie58
Reviews.Content: I've just spent 3 nights in this hotel. What a find! It's position is perfect for getting around Venice, as it's just across the road from the Lido water buses, and there's a lovely beach only a few minutes walk away. The staff are very friendly and helpful. It's really good value as the facilities far outweigh any hotel in the heart of Venice. The peaceful terrace is lovely for chilling out, away from the crowds. We'll definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home - like staying with relatives or friends”
Reviews.Author: allmanfan
Reviews.Content: The very friendly and helpful staff of this small hotel welcome you like a relative or friend would - ideal location just across the pond from the hustle and bustle of Venice so you can easily access all of the culture during the day and have somewhere nice and quiet to relax in the evening. Lots of very good local restaurants and bars within walking distance, a very good one right next door in fact.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent find!”
Reviews.Author: enjoyinglife78
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Panorama offers friendly, attentive, helpful, and honorable staff. The rooms are very clean and comfortable offering peaceful and cozy decor with well-maintained furniture and bathrooms. This hotel is located directly across the street from a docking station for water taxis and water buses making it extremely easy to access with luggage. It is also within walking distance of many excellent shops and restaurants. The island of Lido is a short water taxi ride from Venice and offers a much more relaxed evening environment than the main island. Members of our family have stayed here in the past, and their experiences were the same as ours. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Find!”
Reviews.Author: rpet
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room at an affordable price for Venice. Right at boat launch and extraordinary front desk service. We over slept and missed their breakfast and they produced coffee and croissants for us. Very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: sunshine0163
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and friendly people. Rooms are spacious and clean. A small remark: the choice of bread (breakfast) was limited. I missed a variation of freshly baked rolls/bread.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly, helpful staff, just perfect”
Reviews.Author: SarahEBrown
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to Venice with 5 girlfriends and until 10pm the night before our flight, we were unsure as to whether we would get away or not, due to the Icelandic volcano. For the whole of the previous week, Eugenio had been emailing us with our travel queries and assured us that he would be ready for our arrival whenever that would be. We flew into Marco Polo and because we had cancelled our pre-arranged water taxi (not wanting to forfeit Â£350 as a no-show) we re-booked one at the airport, a return trip, which actually worked out cheaper! We sped across the lagoon and arrived at the water taxi stop right outside the Hotel Panorama. Eugenio was true to his word and although not there in person, had held our rooms which were ready immediately for us. Each room had a double and a zed-bed, fully fitted shower room and looked very comfortable. The vaparetto stop was right outside the hotel which took us daily by waterbus to Venice itself. A multiple use ticket is essential and will be well used, you can buy one at the waterbus stop. After a peaceful night's sleep (shutters at the windows blocked out sound and light) breakfast was eat what you like, continental. Cheese, meats, cereal, yoghurts, breads, pastries with juice tea & coffee. Quite sufficient to last till lunch! Nothing was too much trouble for the cheerful staff, even when we needed some sweets as stakes in a card game at 1 o'clock in the morning! Advice, tips & conversation, all came easily and were always delivered with a smile. As with all of Venice, I would recommend eating away from the main haunts and the Lido was perfect for this. Just around the corner from the hotel there was plenty to choose from at reasonable prices. Even when you are early (before they open?!!) the restaurant staff sit you down with a glass of wine while you wait. Everyone is so friendly and nothing is too much trouble. The Lido is a main stop on the waterbus route so you can get to any island / destination you fancy. As our flight home was not until the evening, we checked out of our rooms and our cases were looked after for the rest of the day at the Hotel, whilst we enjoyed our final hours in Venice, in the sunshine. They even provided some tape to fix a broken suitcase! All in all, I would definitely return to this hotel and would have absolutely no qualms with recommending it to anyone who wishes to visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but VERY noisy”
Reviews.Author: katd234
Reviews.Content: I guess depending on where your room is located, you might have a different experience. Our windows faced the piazza. The noise from the people getting off the boat lasted way into the night. Then at 3 or 4 AM a boat started circling around. I kept praying it would leave, but it continued. Even my trusty earplugs didn't help. So if you're deaf, this hotel is PERFECT for you. In addition, when we first arrived (this was our honeymoon) we were given a tiny, dark room on the lobby level, 10 steps away from the front desk. Room number 11. Since we hadn't seen any of the other rooms, we thought this was standard, however, decided to inquire about other available rooms. Hesitantly, the guy gave us a room on the second floor. HUGE difference. It even had a bidet, whereas the first floor room hardly had a shower (hole on the floor). So that made me angry. But once we were in the upstairs room, we had no problems at all, with the exception of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi110610
Reviews.Content: We have been a lot of places but this was our first visit abroad and it was incredible. Venice was the first spot on our trip to Italy and we couldn't have picked a better spot to start. The hotel was INCREDIBLE and mre than what I could have possibly hoped for. The staff on arriving were gracious and our luggage was quickly whipped into one elevator while we were escorted to the other. We were asked for our passports in order for them to check us in then the whisked us away to our room to freshen up and relax. The room was beautiful as we opened the door and saw several sets of French doors to the outside. The first set opened up over quaint rooftops and lush vegetation (where every morning I would open the shutters and proclaim "Buon Giorno Venice"), the other two sets showed us the boat dock for the Vaporetto---very convienently located across the street and a view of the lagoon. we stayed in a double standard room. There also was a set of Frenchies with a view of the lagoon in the bathrrom. There were SOOOOOOO many perks and suprises to this hotel it was unimaginable--lots of little suprises with the key---good ones. The staff was incredible and breakfast was very good with lots of time to eat and enjoy and relax which seems to be the theme of Italy. We loved the location !!! We spent hours walking around the little neighborhood and looking down alleys and just loving it. We were fortunate enough to be able to go during Carnevale and there definitely was some tourism going on but just enough to make it nice. Once Carnevale ended we had the Lido to ourselves and it was great. The island is about a 20 minute serene ride through the lagoon from the main island. It is a major stop when hopping form island to island. We are planning on returning again next year for Carneval and there is no doubt where we would stay. We would definitely encourage you to stay here--it is everything it appears to be. CIAO!

Reviews.Title: “Back for a third time”
Reviews.Author: caps158
Reviews.Content: This will be our third visit to Hotel Panorama. (We had 1 visit to Danelli as well). Panorama is better in all areas, the staff, the rooms, the views. Not cheap but excellent value. And if you go in September - for the film festival- you get to see all the stars relaxing in a wonderful location. Well done Eugenie and all your staff. We will return. John and Pat

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit better than first!”
Reviews.Author: Tarango
Reviews.Content: We have been to Venice 5 times and have previously stayed off St Mark's Square as well as 2 hotels on the Lido. Last February we had our first experience of the Hotel Panorama and enjoyed it so much when we decided to return this year, the hotel was already decided! Last year we stayed in a deluxe lagoon view room which was fabulous. This year as we would be in Venice over our wedding anniversary we decided to go for their Junior Suite -WOW!!!! Upon arrival to the hotel, we were greeted by very friendly, professional and happy reception staff. Check in was swift and straight forward. We also recognised them from our last trip - which is always nice to see the same faces. We were shown to our room and we set about 'checking it out'. The main room was huge - by far the biggest room we have stayed in on any of our previous Venice trips. We had a huge double bed as well as a lounge area. The bathroom had a jacuzzi bath, seperate shower cubicle, double sink, toilet and bidet - very spacious!! Our room was spotlessly clean. We had a lovely surprise when we returned the first night to have our bed turned down and our wet towels changed!! Breakfast was as good as we remembered. Plenty of variety, service was efficient and friendly. The hotel was not as busy as is was last year (different month) but the staff were not on a go slow or round down - not at all, all the staff were efficient, friendly and chatty. During our stay we had travel disruption and the hotel were very nice to us upon our return from the airport for an enforced additional day in Venice (can think of many worse places to be stranded!!). The following day when we were due to go back to the airport, reception checked our airline, both airports (Marco Polo and Gatwick) to check there were no delays before we left the hotel. I can not recommend this hotel enough. A hotel is nothing without fab staff and this hotel is full of fab staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Birthday Weekend in Venizia!”
Reviews.Author: MrsKimi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Panorama - although it's been over a year since we travelled there, I still have the fondest memories of Hotel Panorama.. staying on the Lido was definitely a good choice, as we were away from the hustle b ustle of Venice, yet had the vaporetto (water bus) system taht ran all night long, so we could go and do whatever, and whenever we pelased! The hotel is so easy to locate, as it's literally by the water bus stop. The room was spacious, comfy, and had a lovely view.. the hotel has a terrace, where you can have breakfast on a sunny morning. There are good transport links from the Lido, and staff are v v v helpful in all aspects, and helped us work our our journeys. On the Lido itself, there are a few restaurants that offer food for much cheaper prices than in San Marco. Commuting daily to San Marco was lovely, as the view is awesome every time! I think 4nights was adequate for a stay in Venice - we got to taste the loca culture, food and walk all over Venice in this time.. what fun!

Reviews.Title: “nicest staff we've met”
Reviews.Author: MiddlesbroughJulia
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Venice we were relocated to the Lido after a mix up with bookings . We've always been sniffy about the Lido but this hotel was delightful. They were kindness itself and offered us a choice of 2 rooms. We opted for the top floor room wirh a view to Venice. It was big and comfortable with a huge sofa and a jacuzzi bath, wonderful for soothing aching legs after a days sightseeing. They also had a free water taxi to Murano on a Tuesday morning and offered excellent advice for places to eat on the Lido itself. The hotel is at the vaporetto stop and it was easy to and from Venice itself. They did a good breakfast and were cheerful and friendly. well done Hotel Panorama!

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Zosterops
Reviews.Content: We travelled with 3 children under the age of 11. We had a really good time at this hotel. It was spotlessly clean, with good quality fittings. Everything that was supposed to work did. We had a hitch initially in that the room we had been promised was overbooked, but the management pleasantly renegotiated a price which kept us happy. The continental breakfast was pleasant, but the dining area was a bit small and crowded. It also seemed stingy that you had to pay for internet access in the lobby! Finding affordable rooms for 5 is difficult. We had to have the youngest child share our bed, and the two older children had rollaway beds. Lido is a short ferry ride from Venice, and has plenty of restaurants a short walk away. The hotel is directly opposite the ferry terminal. The beach was probably 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Travel to Venice, only 10 minutes away”
Reviews.Author: blinkyandme
Reviews.Content: At first glace, it seemed crazy to stay out of Venice after comming all the way from California but I chose this hotel based on recommendations I found on Trip Advisor. I had been to Venice years ago and was put off by all the "touristas" My girlfiend and I could not have been happier. We got a corner room with 4 windows looking out toward San Marcos. The room was clean and very comfortable. The staff are courteous and nice and very helpful. We loved this place After a long days of sightseeing and the crazy of Venice, what could be nicer than walking the quiet streets of Lido? Nothing could be finer. Lido has it's own charm that is not so quaint during the season but is still is a nice place to hide out and recharge for the next encounter with Venice. The Vaparettos come all the time and they are empty by the time they hit Lido so you can easily get a seat in the front or the back of the "bus". That way there is no squishing with the locals and you get a fine view indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in a fun location”
Reviews.Author: TSprinks
Reviews.Content: Hotel Panorama was a fantastic choice for our three nights in Venice. Due to its location on Lido Island, it costs much less than hotels of the same quality in the city. We caught the vaporetto (water bus) from the train station. The vaporetto system is easy, efficient, and a good way to get around. The stop for Lido Island is just steps away from the front door of the Panorama. You can get to San Marco, the city center, in about 30 - 45 minutes on the vaporetto. Its a lovely view coming into the city on the vaporetto, too. I enjoyed our daily "commute" into Venice. If you stay on the Lido, look into getting a Venice Pass which gets you unlimited use of the vaporetto system. I think its about 30 euro for a 3 day pass. A one way ticket on the vaporetto is 6 euro, so if you're going to be hopping around a lot, this is a good deal. The staff were very courteous and helpful with all our questions about transportation and dining options. All spoke excellent English with that distinct Venetian accent...I loved it! The room was decorated in cheerful yellow and green. Our room was on the first floor (which is actually the second floor, since the ground floor is number 0) and was very bright and sunny. We had a corner room, so we had three big windows. The bed was extremely comfy and the AC system worked very well. The bathroom was very spacious, compared with what we had at other places. There was no tub though. The room was spotlessly clean. One complaint I had was that there were not enough electrical outlets. We had to unplug things to charge our phone/camera, etc. This was not a major problem though. The breakfast was good...I especially enjoyed the brioche cioccolato. On nice days, you can have breakfast up on the terrace, which has a nice view of the lagoon and the city of Venice. There are a few good restaurants around the corner and down the street a bit, but dining is probably better across the lagoon. The beach area on the other side of the Lido, which faces the Adriatic Sea, has a nice view as well. We flew out of Venice and got to the airport on the "Alilaguna" boat. Tickets for this are 13 euro each and the boat runs about every 45 minutes or so, leaving from the stop across the street from the hotel. The ride to the airport takes about an hour. So getting around is not a problem at all from the Lido, and this location saves you from the hustle and bustle of Venice, not to mention rolling your luggage across footbridges and tiny little crowded streets in the city. All in all, I really enjoyed the location of the hotel and thought it was an excellent choice. I would definitely stay here again if we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for touring Venice”
Reviews.Author: gvh67
Reviews.Content: This was the ideal base for our first visit to Venice. The location couldn't be more convenient with the vaporetto stop right across the street and direct connections to the airport, St Marks, the Grand Canal and Murano. The staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfasts were better than the norm, and the view across the lagoon to the city skyline from our second floor room was well worth the premium price. Our only problem was that we were wakened during our first night by the loud banging of the window shutters which had come loose during a freak summer thunderstorm. Securing them in the face of the driving wind and rain proved to be impossible which led to a very disturbed night. So, keep an eye on the weather forecast and secure the shutters before retiring if it looks like there's a storm brewing!

Reviews.Title: “superb location for travel and accessing venice, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: DevonRFG
Reviews.Content: first trip to Venice and delighted to be staying on Lido. The Panaroma is literally across the road from the water bus so no dragging your cases through Venice for hours trying to find the hotel as the Water bus from the airport stops at the hotel, similarly easy for the return, use the water bus - the return trip is 25 euros - a water taxi will be 90 one way! The terrace looks towards Venice and has fabulous views of the lagoon. Once there for 33 Euros you get 3 days unlimited travel on most of the water buses (not Alilaguna which do the airport run though) the water buses go every few minutes early until very late at night so you can tour Venice and return to some peace, if it's warm walk 250 metres behind the hotel down to the Adriatic for a swim and go back for dinner in Venice! The Panorama hotel staff were exceptionaly friendly and accomodating and although our room was at the back it stil overlooked part of the lagoon and was very comfortable. Because water buses going to Venice are often empty when they leave Lido you can get a seat in the front/rear outside before the hordes get on at St Marco - just stay on for a cracking view of the Grand canal as the bus goes through Venice. We found Murano glass at 2/3 the price on Burano and just as cheap in the back streets of venice - by the way, for Venice, take a compass, it is beautiful but as there are of course no roads only alleys and there are few signs and the place is a warren, very easy to get lost, although very enjoyable! go to St Marco in the evening to hear the orchestras compete.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, family friendly hotel, to suit all.”
Reviews.Author: Ryanair-Jetsetters
Reviews.Content: We visit Venice every year and always stay on the Lido as it gives a good mix of the city break and a beach holiday. This is the first time in this hotel, with our 18 month old son Georgio. We chose this hotel for its location mainly. Straight off the Vaparetto, across the road into the hotel, perfect! It is a very short and lovely 10 minute stroll to the beach from the hotel, passed all the shops, supermarket, restaurants and more importantly, passed the best gelato (ice cream) shop in Italy. Make sure you stop at the third one on the left. Now back to the hotel. Firstly the room. We were given the Garden room, which was not the biggest room in the world. Especially with a travel cot added. But what it lacked in space it made up for in location. It was away from all the other rooms, so we did not to worry about a crying baby causing a disturbance to others. Plus it was underneath a garden terrace that was accessed from private stairs next to our room, and also from the main hotel. The terrace has stunning views of Venice and beyond. Watching the cruise liners go past is a must. Oh, and the sunset. The hotel is also right next a fantastic restaurant. The breakfast was the ususal Italian delights, with bread, ham, cheese and pastries and all the ususal trimmings. There is no hot food for those of you that like egg and bacon in the morning. The staff were one of the main attractions for us, and because of them we will stay at this hotel again and again. Sabrina, the Reception manager was the most friendly and helpful person you could ever wish to meet. An absolute delight. No matter what we asked her to help us with she always tried her best to accommodate. The same goes for Eugenio who was the manager over night. I cannot say enough how much we enjoyed staying here and would encourage anyone to use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: AandA_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights. It was our first trip to Venice and after the 1st day touring the city, I was so relieved that we had chosen to stay in the much quieter and peaceful Lido. We had requested a room with a view over the lagoon to Venice and that's what we got. The view was amazing. The room itself was lovely and very clean. The only slight complaint would be that the shower cubicle is tiny, but it was adequate. The hotel staff were very, very pleasant and nothing was too much trouble for them. The hotel is only a short walk from the beach where we had a lovely, quiet day. If I return to Venice I will definately stay at Hotel Panorama again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, easy access to Venezia”
Reviews.Author: Veronika001
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is one of the best.. Water taxi just accross the street, easy access to Venezia. We purchased a 2 day pass for the water taxi, it is not worth it, cheaper if you just by the individual tickets. The rooms are very tiny, but Clean. If you are a person that likes larger shower or have a larger body, you may want to ask to see the room. Or just make sure you don't drop the soap! Continenetal breakfast is reasonably good. We loved the fact that the Adriatic Ocean and the beach is jusst 10 minute walk. Many nice inexpensive as well as expensive retaurants to choose from. How ever if you want to cut food and drink costs, there is a nice grocery store near by. Lovely town to walk around quiet and serine. I would definatly stay here again. Veronika

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in venice”
Reviews.Author: gordo00
Reviews.Content: the hotel is on the lido in venice and away from most of the crowds and tourists, but not far enough to make it a pain to get to touristy areas. the hotel staff is very friendly and helpful and the room is very nice. the beach is a 5min walk away from the hotel. the hotel is also very easy to find from the valparetto (water bus). i reccommend relaxing at night on the terrace and enjoy the beautiful venice view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, best of both worlds with the sights and a beach”
Reviews.Author: piesrcool
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideal for the purpose of visiting Venice. We stayed in a lagoon view room and were not disappointed. The view was fantastic, the vaporetto to St Marks square stopped just outside the hotel and ran very regularly during the day. The journey only took about ten minutes and we were very happy to be out of the centre of venice and so close to a lovely beach, it was like having two holidays in one. The staff on reception were very helpful, particularly the rooms manager who could not do enough to help, with a smile for everyone. The only reason that we have not scored full marks is the air conditioning. It worked but was only a light breeze and at the hottest time of the year it could make sleeping uncomfortable. Having said that it wouldn't stop me going back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but clearly not a four star hotel; location can be a problem”
Reviews.Author: WarmWhite
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a convenient location on the island of Lido, far from the main attractions of Venice but close to the Vaporetto (water bus) station. It is housed in a pleasant looking, mustard colored building. The interior, however, is unbefitting for a four star hotel. Our room had broken window handle, the safe was unsafe with a failing lock, and the electric outlets had hazardous knots of cables dangling from them. The breakfast confirmed that this wasnâ€™t a four star hotel, as it had absolutely no fresh ingredients. Everything seemed canned, pre-cooked or refrigerated. Finally, there was a single internet-connected computer, using an archaic system of magnetic cards for access, which sometimes worked and sometimes didnâ€™t. Be aware that the hotelâ€™s location is far, far from the main attractions of Venice in San Marco. On the upside, it means that restaurant prices are lower, that you can see how real Venetians live, and that the only decent beach in Venice is nearby. On the downside, it entails an hour long boat ride from the train station or the parking in Piazzale Roma. It also involves a 20-30 minute Vaporetto rides to San Marco, and means that you cannot return to your hotel by foot. The vaporetti are both expensive (6.5 euro per ride or some 30 euro for a 48 hours ticket) and run infrequently at night. The bright spot was the staff: pleasant, polite and always ready to help, either with a electric adapter, a phone call, or directions. Everybody spoke English and was upbeat. They deserve working for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, very convienent”
Reviews.Author: goldiep
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise. It was so nice to get off the vaporetto after a long flight and just walk across the street to the hotel. Front desk was very helpful in telling us which boats to take to which sights, where to eat on the Lido, etc. Price includes an expanded continental breakfast with some pretty awesome pastries. Room was small, but with a great view of the water.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: whatdidtheromans
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Panorama is very conveniently situated just opposite the Vaparetto stops on the Lido. This means you can start the day with the most stunning vista in Venice as you approach make the crossing from Lido to the main island, whilst you are somewhat away from the tourist throngs. To get to/from Marco Polo airport you can take the #5 ACTV bus from the Piazzale Roma and then boat to the hotel - this is covered if you have the ACTV day ticket. Or you can go directly to/from the airport to Lido by boat, but this will cost you 16 euro with luggage. The hotel has a very nice rooftop terrace from which you can see across the lagoon to the the main island. The bedrooms are comfortable, have minibar, room safe, aircon and Sky TV. The bathrooms look like they've been recently refurbished and are very clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a decent continetal spread, with croissants, bread, ham, cheese, yoghurts, cereals, and some cakes. Just ask for freshly made coffee of your choice. All in all a good overall package.

Reviews.Title: “Panorama - great hotel with fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldCatface
Reviews.Content: The Panorama thoroughly deserves the good reviews it gets on this site. The hotel was literally a walk-in straight off the Alilgiuna water bus. It was spotless and all the staff very friendly and helpful. We asked for double superior and our room was at the front of the hotel with a fantastic view over the lagoon and St Marks. There is also a really nice terrace area with the same views. Some reviews have commented on the noise due to the hotels waterfront location. This is fair comment, but the noise is not excessive and can be avoided by keeping the doors closed and using the AC. Ther lido is generally fairly sedate and has really nice beaches. It is cheaper than central Venice and only a few minutes by the vaparetto bus, so a really good location. Our only criticism of the hotel was that fresh coffee should be served at breakfast rather than through a machine. Overall, great hotel and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful! Nice value!”
Reviews.Author: lmmNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights at Hotel Panorama before we took a cruise to the Greek Isles and Croatia from Venice. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Eugenio and Sabrina were both very nice. We got to know Sabrina more. She is a lovely person and is very helpful. (Note: I found that the staff was more helpful and friendly the more I talked to them. If I wasn't so chatty with them, I don't feel that I would have gotten to know them as much.) This was our first time in Europe so we were a little nervous about where to stay and the only language we know is English. We stayed here based on the price and recommendations of other reviews on Trip Advisor. The only person who didn't speak english was the maid (she also worked in the breakfast room). The hotel is VERY convenient- right across the street from the water buses. The bus system by the way was good and easy to follow. (Although on Friday (our only full day in Venice) the water buses were on strike. Thankfully there were still water buses going back and forth from Lido to San Marco so the strike really didn't impact our vacation.) I loved the water bus rides because everything around you is so picturesque and amazing (I would stand during the rides rather than sit below in the seats). My husband who doesn't like crowds and such was very happy that we stayed on Lido. The room size was fine. It seemed small at first but then once I got use to it it didn't seem as small. We stayed in a standard room with a view. We could have upgraded to a room with a view of St Marks but we didn't feel it was worth the extra 30 or 40 euros per night. Plus there was construction going on around the water bus/waterway in front of the hotel. Just a word of caution- there were some hotels that we saw near St Mark's square that had noisy construction going on. I would have been upset if I payed top dollar for a hotel in that area and there was noisy/ugly construction going on. On Saturday morning before we left to go to the cruise ship, we rode a 4 wheeled bicycle for two around Lido for only 10 euros per hour. It was so much fun! Lido is a beautiful area. My only disappointment with Lido was the fact that the beaches weren't open. You could still go to the beach but it was dirty and there was trash and such around. The beaches open in June. If I went again, I would go in June rather than May. As for restaurants, we ate at the Grand Viale and the Roxy. Both were good. The Grand Viale was better although the service was a bit better at the Roxy. The fettuccine carbonara was amazing! Had we stayed longer I would have like to have tried a few of the other restaurants that were recommended but weren't on the main road near the hotel. We had pizza at the Hotel Rialto (next to the Rialto Bridge) one afternoon- although a bit pricey, it was excellent. I could just go on and on about our stay.....I wish we had more time to explore Lido and Venice. I recommend at least 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value hotel with sub standard rooms - even for Italy and Venice”
Reviews.Author: bluevcone
Reviews.Content: We had a Lagoon view room on the 3rd floor of this hotel. The room was in the eves and to see the view you had to climb up onto a small platform to see out of a small window.Â  The eves were so low that you banged your head getting out of the bed and in the bathroom you could not stand up to have a shower but had to sit on your knees.Â

Reviews.Title: “Last minute Ventian Break”
Reviews.Author: GrubbyGrocers
Reviews.Content: We didn't book this until 4 days before we flew. I am 6 months pregnant and whilst we wanted a 'last holiday away together', we didn't want to travel too far. People had also warned me about going anywhere too hot as I would feel it more. So reputation and reccommendations were crucial (Tripadvisor was consulted at all times). We chose the Lido as it would be the best of both worlds - culture and beach. The Hotel Panorama was ideal and we couldn't believe it when we arrived into the Alilaguna stop to find our hotel straight in front of us! The hotel was ready for us a 2pm and whilst the room was smaller than we were used to, it was clean and nicely presented and had a nice view over the sea and the square. It has a pretty little terrace which is reallty nice to sit on and have drink in the early evening and you can see clearly over to the Campanile and Doge's Palace. The Vaporetto water buses go from the same stop and it is 10 mins over the main sites. There is a ticket booth and it reallt is easy to get around this area. Breakfast was good - meats, cheese, cereals, toast etc and the dining room provides a view over to the main island. The staff were pleasant and helpful and overall the hotel has a very relaxed but professional feel to it. I would have no quarms in reccommendig this hotel - in fact we kept saying how lucky we were with our decision. The Lido offers a lovely public beach (the hotel one wasn't open until the end of May) and it costs 15 Euro for 2 sunbeds and an umbrella for all day (worth it though). The food on the Lido was more 'rustic' - pizza, pasta, salads but all the meals we had there were with good quality ingredients and freshly made. But it was also reasonably priced esp compared to the area around St Marks (we had a dreadful meal here - bland, v v expensive and shoddy service). Overall it was a lovely break and was just what we needed. The temperature was about 33oC and pretty humid -I really felt it being pregnant but you couldn't really wish for nicer weather.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: adabrown
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Hotel Panorama for two nights. It is located on the island of Lido, which is just across from the main center of Venice. While it's kind of a hike from the train station (take the #51 vaporetto - ~45 minutes), it was only a 5-10 minute vaporetto ride to San Marc's square and the rest of Venice. It was very quiet, and Lido is a cute little town - has a beach, and some more affordable shopping and restaurants. The room was very spacious, as was the bathroom. Fairly modern and felt very clean. At first I was alarmed as the heavy drapes did not pull across the windows... I'm a light sleeper and wake with the earliest light - but then we realized staff had come in and shut the wooden shutters, which made the room very dark. :-) Quite a relief. Over all the Hotel Panorama was a perfect find for our brief stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: bopps
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, mainly because of its location. It is on Lido Island and is a lovely distance from mainland Venice. Lido Island is a lovely place to escape to after looking around Venice all day. It has plenty of fine restaurants and shops. The boats run you across to venice or anywhere else in no time and it is a pleasureable experiecne, and all part of the fun I think! There is also a lovely terrace in the hotel that one can sit on and look over across the water at Venice. The staff in the hotel are so nice, they really try to make you feel welcome and are so helpful with information, directions etc. The room itself was a bit small but perfectly clean and comfortable. The air-con was difficult to get right though and that would be my only fault of the hotel. We stayed in april so this may have been worse if we had stayed in june. But perhaps it was a once off issue as they do have air-con and it did work a little just not enough for us. The breakfast was excellent, lovely fresh fruit and cakes appealed to me! It was the usual continental breakfast but did the job and we were full most of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Maireadnewlands
Reviews.Content: We Visited Venice for the first time in March and booked the Panorama hotel based on recommendations given on Tripadvisor. As we only had 4 days, we wanted our trip to be as hassle free as possible and not have to spend time locating our hotel. We made a good choice, our flight arrived in at 7.45pm and we got the Aliguna ferry directly to Lido island at 8.10. The journey takes approx 1 hour and we could not believe when we emerged from the boat to see our hotel in front of us. This contrasts with seeing so many tourists pulling their suitcases around the small alleyways of Venice while trying to locate their accomodation, a nightmare for all. The hotel was very comfortable, spotlessly clean and the staff all very friendly. We got a three day pass for the taxi boat and enjoyed travelling over to Venice proper every day, 10 minutes to St. Mark's square. Lido was a lovely quiet spot, and each morning we walked down to the beach and did a circle walk back to the hotel, about 40 minutes. We ate in restaurants on Lido island each night and were glad to be back, away from the frantic pace of life in the centre of Venice. Venice was the most fantastic city I have ever visited, We will return again and will definitely stay in Panorama Hotel, and have recommended it so all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel with the BEST STAFF EVER (Eugenio)”
Reviews.Author: dleach31
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago, my wife and I wrapped up our Italian Honeymoon in Venice at this wonderful hotel. I wanted something special for her because this was our last stop in Italy. Eugenio at Hotel Panorama made this dream come true. From the moment we arrived they treated us like king and queen. Eugenio knew prior to our visit that it was our Honeymoon (via email), so he gave us the best room there (204 I believe) which overlooked Venice from the top floor. He also arranged a bottle of champagne in our room when we returned from the first night. He did all of this with a smile and he even refuse a tip, and I tried forcing it on him twice. Eugenio made our stay, he even told us where to get the best gondola ride and not to pay over a certain amount. He has all the inside scoops. As for the hotel, it was brilliant. Staying on Lido is a million times better than Venice. To get to Venice you just take a 5 minute water taxi. On Lido you can relax and avoid all the crowds. Their free breakfast was by far the best we had in the 3 hotels in Italy and the breakfast room has the best view of Venice in the morning. Be sure to dine at the restaurant a couple blocks away on the main street. Eugenio recommended it to us and it was the best Italian food we had on the trip. We ate there 3 times over two days. If you are going to Venice stay here and water taxi into Venice. It is beautiful and the best way to experince Venice.

Reviews.Title: “over the top with wonderful personal service........”
Reviews.Author: sdhphoto
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I brought a small group to Hotel Panorama... from the minute we arrived we were treated as friends not just guests... to the person everyone was overwhelmed with the service and how well keep the hotel was.... Rooms are a good size for Venice.. and the ride back and forth to Venice... is actually a relaxing way to end the day.. and see another part of Italy.. and not just the crowded space of Venice... I already look forward to returning.. and this is a not a paid annoucement but a real review and a place that still cares about there guests...

Reviews.Title: “2 days in venice brilliant time at the Panorama Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JJSKent
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with great staff. Clean, quiet and wonderful breakfasts. Stepped straight off the boat and walked into the hotel just a few yards away. Ticket offices right there too. The beach just ten minutes walk is an added bonus with relaxing music being played at the beach cafe that served snacks and wonderful hot chocolate. We were there in February for Carnival. It was cold but sunny and we had just the best time. Good restaurants and snack bars near by too if you do not want to pay Vvenice island prices. Went on a tour of off the beaten track Venice too with a half hour Gondolar ride and Hot chocolate again thrown in for about Â£32.00 each. This was brilliant. search the web and book before you go as this is much cheaper than sorting it out when you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eatmyshoes
Reviews.Content: We booked three rooms with lagoon view for one night. The first thing that I would say is that the staff are extremely friendly & helpful. I would also comment that the Hotel is one of the cleanest in which I have stayed, I would have no hesitation in staying again. The location is really good. Being based on Lido you get the fun of the vaporetto journey which is great. The view over to Venice is superb. The only criticism I would have is that as the Hotel is so close to the water taxi station, you do get constant noise of the boat engines & local buses throughout the night. I think it would be a good idea to get some kind of secondary glazing to cut this out as I did find it quite hard to sleep. As a tip to other guests - take some earplugs and I am serious about that. However, this minor point would not stop me from staying here again. We found the rooms & bathrooms to be fitted to a good standard & the accomodation to be good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marimorle
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Panorama Hotel and it was excellent. We stayed there for 2 nights and since the first day we got to the hotel we realised all staff were very friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and well experienced.Our room was facing the Lagoon and it had a fantastic view of Venice. Morning breakfast was very nice with lots of options. The Panorama has an excellent location in the lovely Lido Island which is only about 10 minutes by vaporetto from Venice, the transportation for the different islands runs every 10-15 minutes.Only two minutes from the hotel you will find a lovely boulevard with shops, nice restaurants in a very relaxed atmosphere. I currently work as a Travel Consultant in the U.K. and I strongly recommend to stay at the Panorama. We had a lovely time in Lido. Thanks a lot to Eugenio who provided us with an excellent customer service and made our stay very pleasant, we hope we can go back to Panorama.

Reviews.Title: “Staff warm, room chilly”
Reviews.Author: kozin58
Reviews.Content: In Venice VCE â€˜Marco Poloâ€™ airport follow the signs to waterbus (vaporetto). You may buy your ticket (12â‚¬ single way) either in baggage claim area or at the quay of waterbuses called ALILAGUNA. It takes 50 minutes through the Venetian lagoon to Lido Island. ALILAGUNA will drop you off at Lido pier, just few steps away (just across the street) from the â€˜Panorama Hotelâ€™. If you prefer water taxi, it is faster but costs 95â‚¬. The staff is warm and helpful, we stayed in a spacious room on the first floor, and it was clean but chilly. There was a problem with the heating system. They offered a good breakfast buffet which is included in room rate. Hotel Panorama is very central, Main Street of Lido starts from Piazzale S.M. Elisabetta in the forecourt of Hotel. Take public bus line â€˜Alberoniâ€™ to see the southern part of Lido Island. A supermarket â€˜Billa Supermercatiâ€™ is only 50 mts away from the hotel on the main street. There are good choices of Italian wines with cheap prices. So donâ€™t forget to bring your corkscrew with you to Venice. Public waterbus â€˜vaporettoâ€™ ACTV Lines #1, #51 and #61 take you to Venice every 5-10 mins. We bought a 36hr pass of ACTV which costs 21â‚¬. Try different lines each time to see different panoramic views through side canals and across St. Marks Bassin, with a view of the center of the town. The journey takes around 10-15 mins to famous St Markâ€™s Square. Line #1 is very slow and stopping everywhere along the Grand Canal and is a budget alternative to romantic moonlit gondola ride. Thanks to Venice Municipality for signs to top attractions in streets like â€˜PER RIALTOâ€™ or â€˜PER SAN MARCOâ€™. Otherwise you will be lost in narrow streets where you only see the sky. Merceria is the busiest shopping street in Venice by the way donâ€™t miss the Mc Donaldâ€™s for free toilets in this street. Pizzeria Peter Pan (Santa Maria Formosa, Calle Lunga, 6249) is a budget choice in this expensive city. They serve good pizza and chicken doner kebab. The rate of our hotel also included a free excursion with a private water taxi to Murano Island to see glass works and glass furnaces. In fact it is a promotion of glass industry of Murano Island and in my opinion this offer is valid in every hotel. Ask for it and donâ€™t miss it you canâ€™t see anywhere how these famous Murano glass masterpieces are shaped in hands. To view Piazza San Marco from Santa Maria della Salute Church (Our Lady of Good Health) is a must, the festivity celebrated every year on 21 November which remembers that irreplaceable possession is only good health. Its story is also very interesting which recalls one of the most virulent plague epidemics and how the Doge, when all remedies seemed to no avail, made a solemn vow to build a church dedicated to the Virgin. A few decades later the painting of a Madonna dating from 1200 which by decree of the Senate on 21 November 1670 from Candia (Crete) was brought to Venice after the war between Turkish Empire and Venice and was set on the high altar. From that 21 November the Madonna was known as the Madonna della Salute. Since then the votive visit to the church is held annually on this date.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: mooeh
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Hotel Panorama - and it was brilliant! It was a very special day for us as I 'popped the question' on the way from the airport to the Hotel. The hotel manager Sabrina was amazingly helpful to organize EVERYTHING - from the private watertaxi, to the flowers and the prosecco. Sabrina and her colleagues made our stay perfect with their organizational skill and local knowledge (good restaurants, things to see etc). The hotel itself has everything you need - for a fraction of the price of similar hotels in Venice itself. And as others have said before, it's kind of nice to escape the craziness of Venice. We stayed in the Junior Suite which has really nice views of San Marco and the bay. It was clean, nice, not huge but well sized for Venice etc. In summary, a perfect stay - and thank you Sabrina and colleagues for making it so special for us!!!

Reviews.Title: “the friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: gana_k
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we never stayed at this hotel but we have to give them credit of how helpful they were when we missed our water bus to the airport. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They arranged everything for us to ensure that we made our flight on time. Their exchange rate was better then the one we got in Venice also. On our next trip to Venice, I think we will make a point of staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The lido, best place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: pugsy57
Reviews.Content: I Love Venice and stay at the Hotel Panorama whenever I am there, The staff are polite and courtious the welcome was warm and friendly, the rooms are clean and spacious, The hotel is on the Lido which is away from the hustle and bustle and tends to be far better value than the rest of the very expensive Venice. Venice is a short water bus ride if you want but I found most of what we wanted was on the lido. Great food and wine and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: babykong
Reviews.Content: There is nothing I can say that hasn't been said already! Hotel Panorama is a fabulous hotel in a gorgeous location with helpful and friendly staff. This was my first trip to Venice and I decided to stay on the Lido; mainly because it is slightly cheaper than staying in central Venice and because it has a beach, which I thought my teenage son and I would appreciate after a hot days sightseeing! We stayed in Venice for three nights and we bought a 72 hour pass at the airport, which enabled us to use the buses and the vaporettos for our entire stay. Word of warning though; this does not include the 'water-taxi' from the airport (Marco Polo) to Venice. But that wasn't a problem. We boarded Bus 5 which took us to Piazzale Roma and from there we caught a vaporetto to the Lido. On our return home we did get the 'water-taxi' from the Lido to the airport, for which we paid 12 euros each. Venice is spectacular and certainly lived up to my expectations. We did a walking tour (around 2 hours) just to get our bearings. The tour also included entry to the Basilica and an optional boat trip to Murano afterwards. Make the most of Venice, don't rush from one 'site' to the next. Venice is heaving with tourists all year round; pushing through the crowds will only lessen your enjoyment of such a beautiful city and raise your blood pressure too! Slow down and enjoy it. Although I thoroughly loved Venice, I have to admit that one of my favourite experiences was hiring bikes on the Lido and spending a few hours exploring the island. The roads are safe and virtually car free. If ever I get the opportunity to return to Venice I would definitely stay on the Lido and at the Hotel Panorama again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect ending to Italy vacation”
Reviews.Author: stett3
Reviews.Content: What a way to end our 3-week vacation in Italy. The Panorama Hotel is a little gem located on Lido Island where the tourist crowds are thin and food is wonderful. We arrived in Venice by train to an exciting storm of rain, lightening, and thunder. It was such a wonderful experience stepping out of the train station into what appeared to be a travel commercial...what a surprising and sudden change. Although it was an exciting first time in Venice, we were anxious to check into the Panorama Hotel. Upon reaching the hotel's front door and despite being drenched, we were warmly greated and helped with our baggage. The warm hospitality never ended. The staff are welcoming, friendly and exceptionally helpful. We could not have chosen a better hotel or location and the ever-friendly staff made the capping of our vacation all the more memorable. Our room overlooked the Venice Lagoon, which is a view worth the extra cost. The room was large, as well as the bathroom. There's Internet access and the breakfast was something to look forward to every morning, but the highlights are definitely the friendliness of the staff, comfort of the rooms and it's close proximity to the ferry stop. We definitely recommend this fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: arcturas21
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Venice, stay on the Lido. It takes you away from the fabulous chaos of Venice and offers a relaxing retreat. It is wonderful to come back accross the lagoon and see the lights twinkling on the water in the evening. You are in the lobby of the hotel after 1 minute of getting off the "vaporetta" - perfect!! There are cafes and restaurants seconds away that offer everything from a delicious pastry with an espresso or vino to amazing restaurants. We had e-mailed back and forth with Sabrina on several occasions. She went out of her way to answer our questions and re-assure us that we would have a perfect holiday and we did! We felt like we were going to meet up with an old friend and it was fantastic to finally meet with her in person. I have stayed in many hotels around the world and never been provided with such a warm, welcoming and gracious service. I also have to hand it to Eugenio who we only met on a couple of occasions, but was also extremely helpful. We will go back to Venice and we will stay in this hotel every time without hesitation. I can't imagine anyone ever having anything negative to say about the hotel staff, amenities and service provided here, it is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: charnwoodfield
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Venice to celebrate my birthday and booked with the hotel direct after reading reviews in the site. The location is perfect with views over the water to Venice and the water bus stop a couple of minutes over the road. You are in the heart of the city within about 15 minutes and have had a ringside seat of all that is going on in the water on the way - water taxis - boats to the other islands - car ferry - cruise ships - working boats. I loved it and you could also see it all from our room 106. It had a double balcony and right next to a large patio on the first floor. They are indeed building a new water bus stop over the road but i think it will block the view from the ground floor as on the day we were leaving they were constructing a canopy that took away very little view from the room One word of warning though - don't take too many clothes if you want to unpack everything as the wardrobe space is very tiny. We had a lovely double bed with a bath, shower etc and the room was always clean. Breakfast was continental and did the business to keep you going till lunch. We walked down the main road to the beach from the hotel and this has lots of restaurants and ice cream parlours that are very tempting!! Venice itself is lovely and there is something to see round every corner. It isn't cheap though and the place is very busy even in September. We ate at several restaurants but to be honest they all display their menus in English and prices look much the same unless you go up market. The cheapest way to eat is on the hoof and buy a lovely roll or piza from a little cafe and wander round. All in all a lovely trip and a very vibrant city. The only tour we did was the Secret Doge's Place one and that was well worth it. The rest of the time we just wandered about and soaked up the atmosphere.We got up the bell tower by leaving it till later in the evening and jsut walked in with no queue. We never made it inside the Basica though as the lines were busy when we were in the Square. I would have no problem staying at The Hotel Panorama again. Good Rooms with good views and friendly staff. Perfect

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect hotel overlooking the Lagoon on the Lido”
Reviews.Author: RichW66
Reviews.Content: Having never travelled to Venice, we wondered how easy this Hotel would be to find considering the main source of transportation is a "vaporetto" (water bus). We need not have worried, you come out of the airport and the signs to the waterbus are very clearly marked right to the stop. It's an hour ride to the Lido which is breathtaking to say the least and as we come into the lagoon the Hotel Panorama was lit up like a Christmas Tree - Beautiful!! It took two minutes to get off the waterbus and into the hotel lobby. The staff here speak excellent English and are very friendly and helpful. My partner went down to the lobby to request an extra pillow and the Concierge got back to the room with pillow in hand before my partner did!! Our room was light, airy, spacious and immaculate with panoramic views over the lagoon and the bathroom all Italian marble and well lit with shower and bidet. The breakfast buffet was a smorgesbord of hams, cheeses, pastries, pates, yoghurts, cereals, toast and fresh rolls to name just a few and free to guests. It was lovely to leave the wonderful chaos of Venice behind of an evening and head back across the lagoon to the Lido with all of it's shops and restaurants. Very, very romantic! They are building a new "vapoertto" stop outside the hotel which would mean that if you stayed in a room on a lower floor, you would lose the view across the lagoon while the construction is in progress, but we had upgraded to a room on the second floor and our views over the lagoon were panoramic and un-obstructed. I think anyone with anything negative to say about this Hotel must be mistaken and of stayed somewhere else!! This Hotel has it all and is excellent value for money. 10 out of 10 Hotel Panorama, We would not stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jbpgh
Reviews.Content: When my husband learned that he had a conference in Lido, and that we would be spending 6 nights on the island, he immediately began an extensive search into hotels there. Happily for us he chose Hotel Panorama. The hotel is wonderful. Outstanding staff members Eugenio and Sabrina made us feel at home, were extremely helpful with all of our questions and requests, and made each one of our interactions feel like conversations with old friends. They are great people. Our room was very clean and well appointed, with complimentary internet access. We had great views of Venice across the lagoon from our corner room vantage point; the breakfast was very good as well. The temporary work being done directly across the street did not bother us. I am extremely sensitive to noise, and for me the hotel was quiet and peaceful, with a great location, within half a block from the â€œvaporettiâ€� boats to Venice, and also next to the center of town. Lido itself was a delightful surprise, and whenever we returned from the hustle and bustle of Venice, we felt like we were coming back to our oasis. We recommend Hotel Panorama most highly.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: HFIrwin
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed at Hotel Panorama at the Venetian Lido for four nights in July 2008. We have already booked to stay five nights in July 2009. It is our first choice hotel for Venice. My favourite view of Venice is that from the Lido across St Mark's Basin towards St Mark's Square. I am not aware of any hotel that can provide a better view of this than Hotel Panorama. The view from its 'superior' rooms and terrace is simply stunning, especially when there is a colourful sunset. In addition, it's interesting watching all the water-borne traffic on the Basin, ie waterbuses, watertaxis, private boats, ferries and cruise boats. The Lido is only ten minutes away from St Mark's Square by waterbus. And Hotel Panorama is right beside the waterbus stop. Venice is a city where the mode of transportation is by boat. Accordingly, I like getting into the spirit of things by using the water-borne transportation. To me, Venice is one of the most fascinating cities in the world. It is unique. Venice gives tourists the opportunity to enjoy history, culture, museums, historical buildings and churches, music and casinos. However, it can be very busy. After a day exploring Venice, it is nice to retreat to the Lido which is quieter to relax. Hotel Panorama also sells vouchers to a private beach. I think they were 10 euros. The hotel rooms and bathrooms were spotlessly clean and very nicely decorated. My parents and I were very comfortable. The hotel staff were excellent. Very professional but also very friendly and helpful. My parents and I are very much looking forward to returning to Hotel Panorama next July.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: DREWTORIA
Reviews.Content: Having read quite a few reviews on this hotel on this site, thought we should leave one ourselves. We stayed here between August 15th - 18th, and everything about our trip was perfect. The hotel location , the rooms, the actual island of Lido, and the ease to which we got to and from Venice. Our room was spacious, we had a lovely view, and breakfast at the hotel is just what you need, and there is a varied choice, of toast, cold meats, fruit, cereal, croissants, cakes etc etc and reception were extremely helpful the whole time. We read some reviews saying that the hotel was near a noisy area - we slept fine every night, or the rooms were small - they were of average size, but how much time do you want in a hotel room in Venice? and the breakfast was awful - if you dont like the food I've listed above, then yes, its awful All in all our trip to Venice was one of the best weekends we have ever had, and Hotel Panorama definitely contributed to that.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny uncomfortable claustrophobic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: aputty
Reviews.Content: What a tiny room! And what a tiny bathroom as well! This hotel felt very claustrophobic, and not relaxing at all. After a long day sightseeing, you would just want to go back to a spacious relaxing retreat, but this was neither spacious nor relaxing! The desk was so close to the bed that you could hardly walk around the bed. The room did not even have a bath tub. The hotel was not near the main sights, you had to take the boat to the island with the main sights. The breakfast was pathetic. Just breads, jams, fruit, and yoghurt. Our room was next to the boat dock so you could hear it constantly. Not pleasant. Venice is really not my cup of tea, far too overrated and touristy. There is not much to see apart from a gondola, and a couple of islands.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: scmommy8
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I stayed at the Hotel Panorama for three nights - July 10-13, 2008 - while visiting Venice. I cannot fully express how wonderful our stay was!!! First off, we were originally concerned with whether not staying in actual Venice was a mistake, however, we quickly discovered that staying in Lido was definitely the way to go! Lido is a very short boat ride away from Venice (not to mention the water buses are right across the street from the hotel), and has a much more casual and less touristy feel. We found Venice to be sooooooooooo busy that it was great to get away from the crowds at the end of the day. Another nice thing about staying on Lido is that the food and especially the drinks (not just alcohol, but also soda) is considerably cheaper! In restaurants in Venice it is not uncommon for Cokes to cost 8 Euros! The hotel itself was very nice, and the breakfast (which was included) was wonderful! The staff at the hotel was exceptionally helpful. We were given a map, good directions, suggestions of places to eat, etc. Staying at the Hotel Panorama also allows access to the private beach in Lido. For 10 Euros, we were able to get access to the beach, our own umbrella and chairs reserved for the day, and beach towels. We really enjoyed the beach! Another plus of the hotel is the roof top terrace from which you can get views of Venice. Even though the hotel does not have a restaurant, there is one right next door that has good food for reasonable prices. The only complaint at all is that the room was not the biggest one we have ever stayed in, however, the furnishings were nice and the bed was comfortable. Also, the bathroom was spacious and nice. Overall a wonderful stay! If going to Venice again I would definitely stay in Lido, and at the Hotel Panorama!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it here”
Reviews.Author: efc607
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed for three nights at the Panorama and loved it. We had booked a triple with and inside view, but because our room wasn't ready when we arrived, the staff kindly upgraded us to a triple with a view of the beautiful Venetian lagoon. The marble bathroom was clean and beautiful, and the decoration was simple but with everything that we needed. A few downsides are that it takes an extra 10-15 minutes to take the boat from the center of town to Lido, but the waterbuses run all night, and we didn't find it to be a problem. Bottom line is, compared to the exorbitant prices of hotels in Venice, I highly recommend the Panorama. One tip is that there appears to be two websites run by the hotel; we found a cheaper rate on the Italian version of the site (there's an English translation link on the site that will convert everything to English for you)

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: IrelandKilkennycat
Reviews.Content: Like others used favourable comments to book this hotel. we took waterbus direct from airport to the Lido and only had to walk across street to hotel. The room was pleasent and the hotel terrace was a bonus. The view across to Venice was spectacular and enjoyed the trips backwards and forwards. What surprised us was how nice the Lido itself was with a nice tree lined boulevard that you could walk to the beach and enjoy a long walk on the beach. Also hired bikes and saw some lovely spots. Would definitely recommend others to stay here, staff very helpful and friendly and a more tranquil setting after the buzz of the unique city of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel & Location for visit to Venice”
Reviews.Author: environrichard
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed in the Panorama Hotel on Lido Island for 3 nights. This hotel is an ideal place to stay for visiting Venice. The hotel is just about 100 meters away from the boat stop on Lido and ideal for catching the boat over to Venice (10 mins to Marks Square). The hotel room we stayed in had a beautiful view of the lagoon over to Venice. The room was standard size and very clean. The staff were very pleasant and helpful if needed. The breakfast was continental with a nice selection. I would definately recommend staying in this hotel and on Lido. It is only a few minutes boat ride from Venice Island and an escape from the Hustle and Bustle at peak season. There is also a beautiful beach on the island. Venice is a must see as it is such an extraordinary place. We really enjoyed the few days. There is loads of places to eat in Venice and on Lido (less expensive on Lido). Transportation is also very good and easy to use whether coming from the Airport or just visiting Islands around Venice. I highly recommend this Hotel and a stay on Lido.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Lido and venice”
Reviews.Author: CelticBhoy81
Reviews.Content: Me and the Fiancee went to venice for 3 nights in January for a break, after doing extensive research, i decided on trying this little family run hotel on Lido, Well when we arrived we were delighted to have chosen this place, the hotel staff were so friendly and the breakfast was excellent choice. we had a lovely room up in attic with jacuzzi bath and views over the lagoon to Venice it was really nice to visit venice in January when it was quite quiet compared to the busy times, although i will add it was only about 3-4 degrees when we were there, so if you are visiting at that time of year take a jacket and gloves and scarf!! Venice itself was beautiful. wonderful shops and some lovely little cafes by the main canals and some good bars just to sit and watch the world go by. it was really nice to be back in Lido at the end of the day with all the locals and just try and blend in and have a few drinks in there bars away from the crowds. There is also some nice restaurtants in Lido, and it was much more reasonably priced than right in the centre of Vennice for food and drinks. Overall i cant fault anything about hotel Panorama and Lido and Venice, we will definetly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic hotel .”
Reviews.Author: 2Caseys
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Panorama on a cold , damp Feb. evening, having been re routed from Treviso to Bergamo . The staff were extremely welcoming.The hotel was spotless as well as stylish.Our room was warm and comfortable - the heated towels in the bathroom were the icing on the cake.That was before we experienced breakfast- definitely the best breakfast I have ever had in my life ! St Mark's square was about 20 mins away by vaporetto, but it was lovely to travel in with the school children in the morning and experience a slice of Italian life. We will be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find”
Reviews.Author: Spike2005
Reviews.Content: We read previous reviews on this hotel on tripmaster and decided to book for February this year. We have just returned having stayed for 3 nights in one of the superior rooms which was well worth the money. We had a large spacious room with gorgeous bathroom with whirlpool bath. All the hotel staff were extremely helpful with everything we asked about and were not even bothered about us taking a pizza and a bottle of wine to our room one night. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa-London7
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked this hotel for 3 nights through the hotel direct. We got out flights cheap with Ryanair. We booked a superior lagoon view room and was not disappointed. We got confirmation from the hotel and then sent us maps of how to get there and asked what time we would be arriving. The room was large with a very comfy double bed, tv that the programmes could be changed to English, mini bar, and lovely big bathroom with hairdryer. The room looked direct arcross the canal to St Marks Square. The bust stop is across the road and takes around 10 minutes to get to St Marks. The staff at this hotel are fantastic and could not do enough to help us. The breakfast was lovely, and fresh cakes and pastries, salamis and cheese, all very nice. A restaurant I really recomment is round the corner from the hotel on the "main" street, its called Gran Viale and is very very nice, around Â£70 for a 3 course meal with wines and coffees, but well worth the money. All I can say is I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and would definately return to room 206 at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The panorama a short ride from venice”
Reviews.Author: mrmundo
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. Cannot fault it, had an upgraded room with a view of venice accross the bay. Staff very helpful, breakfast was very good with a wide choice and plenty of it if you are hungry. Rooms lovely and the bed was so so comfortable. It is about a 10 min water taxi ride into venice which is no problem as I found this a wonderful way to approach the most beautiful city in the world. It would probably be a good idea to get a travel pass (ACTV) which can get you by coach into venice and then a water tax to th lido. We had a 3 day pass so travelled all around the city/island of murano etc. The travel pass for 72hrs was 30 euros each which is great value for money. The water taxis run 24/7 and it was nice to get back to the lido which at this time of year is much quieter as it is more of a summer resort. Even so there were restaurants and cafes/supermarket nearby. It was our first time in venice, we shall return and trip advisor has once again helped us to select a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and value”
Reviews.Author: evildoug13
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay in Venice, before a cruise, started with 2 great days at the Hotel Panorama. It is very easily accessible by vaporettos, which stop 100 feet from the hotel entrance. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was on the small side, but we had a nice view of the lagoon. We had a nice complimentary breakfast buffet every morning, which included juices, coffee, tea, pastries, fruit, breads, yogurts and more. They recommended a few dining options and each turned out wonderful. Unless you have a real need to be on the island of Venice, save the money you would have used for more expensive hotels and use it on tours or dinners. It was well worth the 10 miunute vaporetto ride to us. Thanks to the great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: doblersdream
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Panorama for 4 nights in December 2007.Even though i booked through a third party website, the hotel emailed their own confirmation of booking with detailed and helpful directions from the airport. When we arrived, we were greeted very warmly. Our bags were taken promptly to own room and we were shown round the room. Complimentary coffee was brought to the room, then 15 minutes later reception phoned the room to check that everything was OK. The staff were always the model of professionalism - friendly, helpful (free guide book, free maps offered without asking). Breakfast was a basic continental selection of breads, meats and pastries, but always fresh and tasty.
