Our double corner room had 2 walkout balconies with a great view across St Mark's Basin to Venice. It was warm, very comfortable and very cosy. Don't let the Lido location put you off. The waterbus is literally 30 seconds away from the hotel and takes you to Venice in less than 15 mins. Food is superb on Lido and cheaper than in Venice itself. Tip - Buy a travelpass for the number of days you intend to be there and you get unlimited waterbus rides around all the islands at a discounted rate. We plan to visit Venice next time in the summertime, and will definitely be staying at the Hotel Panorama.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: lovetobeinparis
Reviews.Content: We satyed in room 203 for one night and it was a nightmare. That room had a partial view of the water and at night time it was super loud. The room was small and the TV didn't have CNN or any english channel. We were up most of the first night and in the morning we asked if we could change rooms. At first the lady at the desk said they only had a suprior room facing the water. Then some other guy asked us a few question and spoke to the lady and decided to change our room. The second room was quite and the TV had the English channels!! The breakfast was Ok, OJ was awful and a couple of times we found dead flies in our glass. The staff was helpful, but next time I will not stay in Lido. The weather was cold and windy, so we were forced to stay in at night. We had lunch at Trattoria Favorita (Lido) our first day and the food was Ok.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lido”
Reviews.Author: CroydonLottie
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at this hotel.Room small ( 203) partial view of lagoon, fine for a shortish stay.Loved the breakfast and loved the street cafes in the locality.Nice tourist menu at the Gran Viale Restaurant,19 or 26 euros per person from memory depending on 2or 3 courses.Watch out for the yellow machines when you authenticate your Vaporetta passes for the first time on the Lido,it wouldnt return my pass,30 euros worth,so i guarded it against further use until a ACTV man could attend with his keys,it all worked out in the end ! Consider late September or early October for visiting Venice,the evenings started to get chilly when we visited (10th Oct )

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: margNorthumberland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Hotel Panorama/Venice and very much enjoyed ourselves. We liked to be away from the crowds in Venice itself , and loved light/space and cleanliness of the Lido. We had a standard double room which was a bit small, but we were hardly in it! very comfortable though. Gianfranco especially was extremely helpful ,and his staff also very pleasant. We met up with friends from Austria but the Panorama was booked up so they had to stay elsewhere, Wonderful restaurant also on Lido called "Andri" beside the canal, atosphere, food, staff all excellent and very reasonable 60 euros for two, inc. wine and 3 courses!! All in all, we had a fabulous trip, Venice is unique and we loved it! Hopefully we will return to visit the sites we missed. Marg

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Aljanon
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights in October and enjoyed our time at the panorama.Booked a standard room which was rather small .Beds comfortable ,bathroom small but adequate,shower good. Early morning noise from vaporetto stops but I am a light sleeper.Breakfast O/K.Staff friendly and helpful.This was My first visit to Venice ,not sure if I would choose to stay on Lido for my next visit but If I did would probably check out this hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “panoramic Panorama”
Reviews.Author: notnecessary
Reviews.Content: All of the above, with a certain caveat. The hotel has a very limited number of lower priced rooms and you probably don't want them, ie, right off the lobby (noisy), handicapped shower, etc. We booked a standard room and it wasn't what we expected. The staff immediately offered to move us to a nearby hotel or change our room the next day. We changed the next day to the garden, quite lovely. The hotel has been remodeled with double paned windows and wooden shutters which close fully at night, making it quiet even though it is located at a busy spot, just across from the Vaparetto stop. The hotel was very clean, breakfast was fine and the view from the terrrace not to be missed at sunset, especially if you can toast one of the large cruise ships on her way out. We stay on the Lido when in Venice as it is not as madding as in town with the bazillion tourists. It's only a short vaparetto ride into 'town' for dinner, given that the Lido restaurants are more casual. Plus Lido hotels are about half the price of the ritzy in-town digs.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: RJ_70
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! We stayed here for 5 nights and were wondering whether we'd made the right choice staying on Lido rather than in Venice itself. Any doubts disappeared when we arrived, The hotel is immaculate, the staff is friendly and helpful and the location is great. We had one of the rooms with a balcony which overlook the waterfront. The vaporetti stop was just across the square and the boats run every few minutes from early morning into the night. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience of arriving into Venice by boat each morning, and the short trip home was a lovely way to unwind after a long day's sightseeing. Getting to and from the airport couldn't have been easier (using the Alilaguna boat service, which also stops within 100 metres of the hotel). Our room was comfortable, quiet and felt like a home from home. When we come back to Venice, we will definitely stay here again. Venice itself was everything we had hoped it would be and more besides. The weather was fantastic and as it was out of season, it wasn't too busy (except perhaps in St Mark's Square in the middle of the day).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff and location”
Reviews.Author: MizT1955
Reviews.Content: Our party of 10 stayed in 5 rooms at the Hotel Panorama in July '07. My room was "deluxe" and had a small balcony overlooking the water towards Venice (Panorama is on Lido, about a 10 min. watertaxi ride to Venice). The room was very well-kept, clean and had a large, very clean bathroom. The staff was fabulous--helpful, pleasant, knowledgeable, and made sure we had ice cubes! The breakfast buffet was excellent--very fresh, wide variety of foods, in an attractive setting, and they had help on hand to brew fresh espresso, cappuccino, etc. The island of Lido is small but packed with some very good restaurants and gelato "shops". Also found a supermarket within 2 blocks of Panorama which was very convenient. The beach, on the other side of the island of Lido, is about a 10-15 minute walk and lovely. Had a wonderful time, would definitely stay at Hotel Panorama again...and again....

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FMB1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 10 days on our honeymoon and had a fantastic time. The hotel was great for our purposes. It was clean and tidy and the staff were helpful. The hotel's two best aspects are its terrace and its location. We tended to go to the local supermarket for delicious cheap Italian food and take it onto the terrace for a leisurely lunch. The location of the hotel was amazing. It was just across the road from the water bus station and when we got a water taxi (an expensive treat, but more fun than a gondola ride!) it dropped us off just across from the hotel. The hotel is just near the top of Lido's main tourist street and about a 15 minute walk from the beech. There were some great restaurants on Lido's main street. We particularly liked La Cupola. It's more of a cafe than a restaurant, but the food is better than anything we had in Venice and a lot cheaper. It's run by a genuinely nice family and they treated us so well - it really made the holiday! We also loved a bar on the beach called the Aurora Beach club. They had delicious cocktails, but if you're on a budget, just ask for a spritzer - they're cheap and quite strong! We spent most of our time on Lido, on the beach or going for walks. When we did venture into Venice, we took a water bus, which only takes about 10 minutes. Venice is beautiful and very impressive, but very busy and full of tourists. We enjoyed wandering round the Rialto Market to pick up holiday gifts. We sat and had a couple of rip-off Bellinis in St Mark's Square (15 euros per drink and tasted horrible!). We went on a gondola ride. Again, a bit of a rip-off, but you've got to do it once, I suppose! We paid 100 euro for 30 mins. Even though we enjoyed Venice, we were relieved to get the water bus back to slow paced Lido. Don't go to Lido if you want a party atmosphere, though. Most bars are shut by 12. It's a great place for couples and amazing for families. Children are everywhere and everyone seems to keep their kids up till about 11 at night. It's great, because all places really welcome children and it means you don't have to worry about a babysitter - just take them out with you. The aurora beach club is partially on the sand, so parents can enjoy a drink whilst watching their kids run about on the sand. If I was to say anything negative, it's quite expensive to stay at the hotel - I guess you're paying for the location, though. All in all, a wonderful holiday and we'll hopefully be going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Base”
Reviews.Author: MrBenn7
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Panorama on Wednesday 22nd August and left on the 25th ( 3 nights ) Our stay was fantastic!! You will NOT be disappointed with the hotel. The staff are brilliant, accommodation is spotless and well furnished, and for location we were not disappointed. Our room - we asked for a Superior Room and were allocated attic room ( rm 302) 2 skylights and a further window overlooking Venice and the lagoon. ( You did need to use a small step to view.... but what a view! ) Situated overlooking the lagoon and the Lido waterbus station it was ideal. The room was very spacious with Kingsize bed and bath/jacuzzi. We were very happy! If you are looking for a place to escape the hussle and bussle of St Marks etc, but to be within 10 mins reach by waterbus... then the Lido is for you. We visited the private beach one day ( 15 min stroll along the front ) and were pleasantly surprised. The beach was very clean and so large. Small chalets and cubicles stretch along the full length, but so much space... ! It cost us 20Euro for the privelidge and the towels. We booked through reception and they provided towels. Dont expect too much to be happening in the evening on the Lido... its very laid back and most places were closing at 11pm. The Mitie Pizzarie on the Gran Viale ( main road through Lido ) and 3 mins from the hotel stayed open longest and for snacks and ice creams was very good! Staff excellent..... but dont forget St Marks Sq is 10 mins away if you want MORE! "Gran Viale Restaurant" & "Favorite" are the two main restaurants on the Lido. We ate in the Gran Viale and food was excellent but service not so good... very busy and local personalities received preferencial treatment. Having said that it was very reasonable 75 Euros for 2 courses for 2 people and 2 bottles of wine. "Favorite" .. we just could not get in, it was fully booked on all 3 evenings! Negatives We flew into Treviso with Ryan Air. 1 Hr transport time to Plaza Roma then a further 40 mins to the Panorama on Waterbus. Waterbus journey was no issue at all and the time flew! Treviso Airport Departure - they had not got a clue! Chaos as one passport control officer was dealing single handedly with 5 flights. Very little in the airport either other than one coffee bar and a few small shops. Taxi fares - EXPENSIVE !! Positives At the airport we purchased 9 Euro return shuttle bus and 30 euro Waterbus pass for our 3 days. These were worth it. As you come through arrivals the transport booth is to your right... go straight to it and you may avoid the queues once everyone realises where they need to get their own tickets from! Hotel Staff - nothing is too much trouble Hotel Location - perfect to escape the crowds but within easy reach of main attractions. The Lido - chilled Hotel Breakfast - Continental but excellent. Ask for a tray and take it up to the 1st floor terrace and enjoy the views! Venice itself... 1st visit and we were blown away. We loved it, St Marks, Rialto, etc, etc. Marvelous !! ... and there was no smell!! Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little place”
Reviews.Author: dannikitten
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, well furnished and very clean with all the amenities you would expect of a 4 star hotel. I would tell you all about the great points, however the other reviewers have already written about those. My complaints would be: When we arrived we tried to use their wifi internet access but it wasn't working, I went to complain but the man on reception didn't report it to the manager or anybody else (they use quite a few staff members and rotate the receptionists). The following day we complained again to a younger receptionist who helped us out explaining they'd either fix it or let use use their pc downstairs for free. After 3 days it was up and running so we were ok. As for the breakfast there, it was wonderful everyday, lots of choices and everything was of excellent quality however we had to get down to the breakfast room early everyday because all the good ham was always gone by 9 (breakfast is from 07:30 - 10:00). The major let-down was the air conditioning in our room, it wouldn't stop sqeaking like a hamster's excercise wheel, all day and all night. We didn't even keep the air con on, when it was "off" it was in fan mode so it still squealed. We didn't complain however because although the room was a standard one, it was a very nice standard with 3 windows, one looking out to the terrace and 2 out to the street therefore it was very bright and airy. We didn't want the room swapped and we didn't want to be kept put of the room indefinitely while they fixed the fan. Another complaint is the fact that on the hotel's website they mention "access to a private beach" and also says the hotel is only a 5 min walk from the beach but it gives no more info. Well, the 5 min walk is to the free beach (which in August is obviously totally packed and a bit dirty (fag ends in the sand). The private beach is a good 20 min walk away from the hotel and it's not complimentary, it's concessionary. When customers of the Panorama use this beach, they charge 10 Euros per person per day (at least they did when we went, in August). It's a lovely beach, very clean and not at all crowded with clean toilet and wash-hand facilities and showers at hand. This entitles you to a parasol and reclining sun loungers. But, at 10 Euros per person per day, it soon adds up! We had a lovely holiday here and comparing this hotel to the others on the Lido in terms of quality and location this is definitely the best.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TJohn7585
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop on a 2 week holiday to France and Italy. It was our favorite hotel. Small, clean, newly renovated, perfect location, beautiful views, helpful staff, nice breakfast buffet. (We picked the Panorama Hotel based in reviews we read here on Tripadvisor.) This was our first time in Venice. We were so glad we stayed here on Lido and could escape the crowds in Venice. I would recommed rising early, going to Venice in the quiet of morning, sightseeing until 2 PM or so and then heading back to Lido to relax, dine, stroll the beach and mix with the local people enjoying their summer. Ask the hotel staff for dinner recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem”
Reviews.Author: EnglishRose169
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend the Panorama if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of Venice. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are well furnished, if a bit on the small side, but you don't spend that much time in your room anyway. The Lido is a nice alternative to central Venice with a number of shops, bars & out door cafes, but only a 10 min ride into Venice. The views of Venice from the Hotel, especially as the sun sets are amazing, worth the stay alone. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: S.Divall
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, clean , friendly staff and ideal location. Loved Venice but was glad not to be on Venice island (very busy) this hotel on the Lido is perfect. You can visit the beach and the shops along the way. Water bus station right outside hotel. Lovely breakfast and Gian Franco on front desk cannot do enough to assist you. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterHarry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Panorama for 6 nights from 17th July. Great location, easily accessible into Venice. The beach is gorgeous (15 euros per couple) for sun loungers and umbrella and during July really quiet. We stayed in Room 209 which was lovely with partial views to the lagoon and St Marks. The air conditioning worked but was not great. We ate most nights on the Lido and as previous reviewer said if you would like a really nice restaurant such as La Favorita, then book ahead. We ate at the Bounty Bar a few times which is on the other side of the Gran Viale, really simple but great food. DONT EAT at the restaurant next door to the hotel (to the left as you come out of the hotel front door). Food was below average, service terrible but they still added on 6 euros cover charge and 6 euros tip. Panorama staff are extremely helpful and I wouldn't hesitate on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Panorama”
Reviews.Author: PJG2224
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 1 week with my two kids (aged 7 and 9). Lido Island was the perfect place to anchor and do day trips into Venice. There was the beach (10 min walk) from the hotel with umbrellas and chairs with beach towels (note: cost is 10 euros per adult, children free. Access fees to beaches for chairs and umbrellas is common in Italy. This cost is less at the hotel than if you buy it at the beach access entrance). The view from our room 106 was spectacular! well worth the cost. Wonderful continental breakfast and Eugenio, Davide and Sabrina were great hosts always willing to suggest ideas. Word of caution: Parking is very limited. Do tell them if you will be parking and tell them when you will be leaving. Parking is free. Will not repeat the positive points already mentioned other than to say that they are accurate. Prices are considerably lower for restaurants on the Lido....the beach resort of the Venetians! If you are travelling with kids, this is the place to be. And yes, there is air conditioning and it did not smell!

Reviews.Title: “A Brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: Donna_83
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Panorama for 3 nights 6 â€“ 9th July. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice. Lido is a great base, Itâ€™s a simple 10 minute waterbus journey to Venice itself, the boat dropping you off directly at Saint Markâ€™s Square, we found this to be much easier (and probably a lot quicker) than fighting your way through the crowds in the narrow streets of Venice to get to the main attractions. The Lido is also a much cheaper alternative for food and drink, while not compromising on quality. There is an abundance of bars and restaurants on the Lido, all within easy walking distance from the hotel. We asked at the hotel for recommendations for our last night and the gentleman at reception called around for us until he found a table at a lovely restaurant around the corner. Our first 2 choices were fully booked so if youâ€™re wanting to make sure you can get into a nice restaurant one night I suggest you book in advance. We made use of the terrace a few times during our stay, the waiter will take your drinks order from there. The view is lovely, although you need to stand to see most of it as the railing comes up a little too high to get the full effect when sitting down! We also took breakfast up there on our last day, you will need to ask for a tray. The breakfast itself was lovelyâ€¦ I went for croissants, unfortunately no plain ones in sight.. either fruit, custard or chocolate. There was a good selection of cereals, cheese, ham, fruit and bread for toast. We were booked into a superior room with a lagoon view. The room was a little on the small side but had everything we needed. The bathroom was a good size, massive sink, shower was adequate if a little smaller than we were used to. The bedroom had a gorgeous view of Venice over the lagoon, the waterbus stop was directly opposite, however the sound was almost completely blocked out once the window and shutters were closed. We had a little disturbance on our first night with people talking (Loudly!) and slamming doors in the corridor, this was a one off however as we had no trouble the second and third nights. The TV has Sky and there are 2 or 3 English news channels. We did have a slight problem one night when ordering a film through Sky, we selected it in English, however when the film started it was dubbed in Italian. We spoke to the receptionist and we were not charged for this at the end of our stay. The journey to the hotel from the airport was very simple. We purchased our tickets for the airport waterbus from the airport itself (12 euros), and we also purchased our 72 hour Vaparetto (Waterbus) ticket at the same time (30 Euros). One thing we were not told was that you must stamp these waterbus tickets using the yellow machines at the waterbus stopsâ€¦ one of the ticket inspectors had to handwrite the date and time we bought the tickets on herself.. oops. The airport bus stops at Murano before heading to the Lido.. it takes about an hour. However, you can see the hotel from the bus a few minutes before we reach the stop. So no asking for directions! Heading into Venice we took the number 1 over to Saint Markâ€™s Square, this takes 10/15 minutes, the buses run until about 12, but there is also a night bus service. We visited Saint Markâ€™s Basilica, there is always a large queue outside but it moves pretty quickly, entrance is free, unless you want to go upstairs for the view, which is 3 Euros. The basilica is lovely inside, and even more magnificent on the outside. We also did the tour of the Dogeâ€™s Palace. We did try to book the Secret Itineraries tour before we went but tickets were all sold out. We paid 12 euros each to gain entry and purchased an audio guide for 5 euros each and walked around the palace ourselves, the architecture and decoration is absolutely outstanding, the history is extremely interesting and the views from some of the rooms are well worth a photo or two. We did a lot of walking in Venice, and got lost in backstreets on more than one occasion, however, we always found a waterbus stop (eventually) to take us exactly where we were heading. We were extremely surprised to find weâ€™d walked the entire length of Venice at one point! The shopping is great, lots of back street gift shops.. the handbag shops are wonderful, and theyâ€™re everywhere, and my partner bought a few silk ties at very reasonable prices. As some of the other reviews mentioned.. beware of the pigeons in Saint Markâ€™s Square, there are locals who sell bags of popcorn to entice the pigeons to sit on your hands and arms for photo opportunities. While I couldnâ€™t think of anything worse, there were a lot of tourists doing just that. On the whole an extremely enjoyable break. Iâ€™ve tried to give as many tips and info as I can hereâ€¦. We got most of our info from reviews found here and elsewhere so I hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Off to a bad start but things improved.”
Reviews.Author: Jockscrap
Reviews.Content: After a bad journey with 3 and a half hour delays, the Venice baggage handlers took 1 hour to get the bags off the plane and onto the carousal. A straightforward journey by boat took us to Lido. You buy the ticket for the airport - Lido route from the ticket office near the exit. Save yourself a bit of time later and buy your multi trip water bus ticket now. The Hotel is just across the road from the water bus stop so we were at the reception within a minute of arriving on Lido. After listening to our travel tales of woe, the receptionist then shrugged his shoulders and told us that our room had been double booked but they would put us up in a different room, and move us the following day (there are several reviews on this and other sites that mention the 'accidental' double bookings...BE WARNED). This other room was a few metres from the reception desk, with one tiny shuttered window which you wouldn't open as it was right next to a back street, at street level, with people literally walking 2 inches away. we said that we found the room completely unacceptable and were told ' But it's only for one night'. As this was my fortieth birthday, and we were only there for 5 nights, this was small consolation. My husband was really gutted that his special treat to me had been messed up. It was agreed that we would go to a hotel along the road. The first room they showed us there was just about as bad, but after explaining the shambles and disappointment because of the Hotel Panorama, they showed us a suite, which we accepted and stayed in for the first night. Things improved from there. Our room was at the front of the hotel (double room with lagoon view, on Expedia). Although it wasn't big, it was nicely decorated and very clean. we were given a complimentary bottle of something fizzy the first night there. The rooms are described as having 'en suite bathrooms' but ours just had a shower . The cubicle was tiny, with a smallish opening into it, which could be a problem if you are on the large side. Sky TV was included, and the room had a good fully adjustable aircon system installed. The bus stop wasn't noisy at all, and the big plus point with this hotel is its ideal location, and the frequent water buses. We didn't wait longer than 5 minutes for any bus. Breakfasts were good. Plates on the buffet were continuously topped up. The pure fruit juices were lovely, lots of fresh fruit, beautiful fresh pastries, crackers, toast, ham, cheeses, jam, big choice of cereals, yoghurts etc. We went to the opera one night, purchasing the tickets in the hotel, and it was a fantastic experience. The trip to the murano glass factory by private taxi is to drum up sales of course, and not the hotel being loving and giving . Use it as a way of getting over to Murano in comfort, race round the factory, admire the glass (6 tumblers for E250 anyone?) and use your own water bus pass to get you home. Do not expect to get the private taxi back if you haven't bought anything! We expected to eat on Lido most nights, but only had an evening meal there once, prefering to head off into Venice and get lost in the maze of backstreets. The window shopping is superb, the backstreet restaurants were really good, and very reasonable (E4.50 for 1/2 bottle wine, E7 for a plate of pasta, E4 for a mixed salad) and the snack lunches were really cheap...E3.50 for a delicious hot snack of rolled up thin pizza base filled with roasted veg and cheese. We saw loads of shops with very reasonably priced things in them, certainly no more expensive than home, and we were spoilt for choice with gifts to bring back home. The leather handbags seemed really reasonable. We loved Venice. Enjoy a long water bus ride (No 1) along the whole length of the Grand Canal. Get off at stops along the way and wander around the streets. You will definitely get lost, but that's all part of the fun. The yellow street signs that you follow to get to the main attractions have a funny habit of disappearing, and all sense of direction leaves you as soon as you enter these narrow, twisting streets. Top tip: wear your most comfortable shoes. You'll walk 10 times further than you think you will. We spent one full day on the hotel's private beach. There is a E10 per day charge per person for this, which includes the use of changing rooms, a parasol and sun beds. Towels are available from the hotel with a refundable deposit of E10 each. We didn't pay the fee for the beach as we believed it to be included in our hotel package. Expedia made no mention that we saw, of a charge for these facilities. The beach is well worth a visit. Vast, clean and virtually empty, it's a great way to rest your feet in preparation for another day's sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Everything the Reviews said, and MORE!”
Reviews.Author: RedZoneGlobal
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on other reviews, and it did not disappoint! I had emailed the Panorama for travel instructions, as we were completing a cruise from Barcelona to Venice. Eugenio at the Panorama, graciously took the time to give us three seperate options from the cruise terminal to the hotel. We arrived at 10:30AM, and Eugenio checked us in, and got us into a room within 30 minutes. (I was totally impressed).. Words cannot describe now nice it is to stay on Lido, compared to Venice proper. We were able to take the water buses across the canal, and fight the crowds, noise, and terrible food in Venice, and then arrive back to Lido, where it was quiet, and peaceful. The cafe' next to the hotel is wonderful, and has great pizza and pasta dishes. Sample some of the Nasta Azurro beer also, it's really smooth. The automatic coffee machine was down one morning, and the staff made fresh latte's and cappucinno's for everyone with a smile. Internet access is superb, and you buy 24 hrs worth of access, that you can spread across your entire stay. After paying $.50 a minute on the cruise ship, I was in heaven.. The staff never hesitated to take the time, to address our questions about various sites, and always gave us the best routes to our day trip destinations. Food is better on Lido, and a third the price, compared to Venice. It takes 15 minutes via water bus to the San Marco Square. We did do the private Murano tour, but we had planned on purchasing a nice piece. The Marco Polo gallery was friendly, and we went on a Sunday, so it was less crowded. We watched a quick demonstration, and browsed the gallery for 30 minutes. We were "NOT" pressured in the least, and even when there was a communication issue over price on two pieces, the gallery staff apologized. They left us alone to make our decision, and we left with our purchases. Complimentary water taxi both ways, which was a nice gesture! I've traveled Europe and Russia extensively over the past several years, and I give the Panorama, a 10 out of 10 rating, across the board. Thanks Eugenio for making our stay in Venice, so wonderful! K. Pettersen

Reviews.Title: “STAY AT THIS HOTEL - you won't be disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: Keri6
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 5 nights at Hotel Panorama for our 1 year wedding anniversary. We decided upon Venice as we had always wanted to visit, and as it was such a notoriously romantic destination, it was a perfect choice to celebrate our first year of marriage! Lido is a fantastic place to base yourself from, not only is it EXTREMELY cheaper than staying in the centre of Venice itself, but it is perfect positioning to get around to see all the sights without lugging your heavy suitcases over bridges and cobbled busy streets. You have the best of both worlds if you choose to stay on Lido...you have the beach within easy walking distance (10 mins, I'd say!) and it is fantastically served by vaporetto (water buses) that were always on time when we were there, and really put our transport system to shame!! Firstly you get the Alilaguna to Lido from the airport which is 12 Euro and takes about 50 mins. Once arriving at Lido the Hotel Panorama is right opposite where you get off!! So just a few paces to your left and you'll be in the comfort of a fantastic hotel. The no 1 and 51 vaporetto takes you in and out of Venice centre and if you stay aboard, it'll take you on a lovely journey down the grand canal. A 72hr ticket costs you just 30 Euros...Bargain!!! I'm quite a fussy traveller and always check trip advisor before I book anything. I have never posted a review before, so hopefully the fact that I am doing so now to speak out about the Hotel Panorama should in itself, speak volumes! The rooms were spotlessly clean, and were served everyday by the chamber maid. Our bed was also turned down of a night time, which was something I certainly didn't expect!! But was a lovely touch! The breakfast was typically European..not a full English in sight! However, saying that it was just what we needed to start the day and there was plenty of choice. You could even have it taken up to the roof terrace, so you could enjoy your breakfast with stunning scenery! The staff were extremely helpful and couldn't do enough for you! Giving us various maps, circling all the sights, where to catch the vaporettos, even discussing our departue flight time to help us get back to the airport. They were really friendly, kind and nothing was too much trouble! I have been telling everyone at my work about my holiday (they have asked!!) and one lady who was planning on visiting Venice had already decided that she's going to stay at Hotel Panorama! One more thing, we flew from East Midlands with Easyjet and found both the airport and airline fantastic!! The staff at the airport were really friendly and we were treated in a pleasant manner during the security checks (unlike some airports!). Oh yeah, Ladies, your handbag counts as your ONE piece of hand luggage! I just stuffed mine into my flight bag and so was ok!! The Easyjet staff were extremely polite and friendly..I feel quite bad to say that I wasn't expecting this with it being a budget airline, I but I'm glad we flew with them and will definately be doing so again in the future...UNLIKE MY TRAVEL who we flew to Brazil with and were diabolical, ignorant, rude, unhelpful, etc....!!! Anyway, hope you hadn't lost interest as this review was so long, but have great time if you do decide to stay at Hotel Panorama, and I'm sure you'll love Venice!!! P.S No, it doesn't smell!!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Panoramic”
Reviews.Author: Krome1978
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel in April, the sheer location of it is just perfect, being opposite the Vaporetto stop, it helps when coming back from a long day of sightseeing around Venice. The staff are helpful, they understand english very well and the service is of a high standard, no complaints there. The breakfast bufffet has a large variety and will suit almost anyone regardless of your taste and background. The rooms are just right in size with excellent facilities, satellite TV, safe etc... everything one would expect from a 4 star hotel, we would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ry77mcm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after a co-worker from Italy reccommended it. Amazing place. Small yet nice. The rooms were very clean and because they were underbooked we got a free upgrade. Nice included breakfast, all cold pasteries, yogurts, juices. Just as easy to go to the supermarket around the corner and get some terriffic fresh bread. Great location. We had an amazing view of Venice from our balcony. The #1 vapretto stops right across the street, just a 10 minute ride to Venice. The concierge was amazing, spoke 5 languages and could help you with everything! Such a help. I would totally stay again! But would check out the island of Lido more....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: ChocolateBrownie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 6 days at the Hotel Panorama on Lido in Venice. The hotel is fantastic! We read all of the reviews before we went so were not too worried, but there was not any reason to be worried at all! The hotel is in the perfect location, as some of the other reviews said it is right across the road from the vaperetto stop and it does literally take 10 minutes to get to St. Marks Square. It was so nice to be able to go across and be in amongst the hustle and bustle but then be able to go back to Lido, which is alot quieter. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were too. They were an average size, with AC, Sky TV, mini bar and even a sofa bed. They were cleaned every morning and the maid would turn the beds down in the evenings. The staff are very helpful, when we arrived on the first day the reception staff didn't hesitate in helping us to find our bearings. They gave us a map, pointed out the main attractions, told us which vaperetto to catch and recommended some restaurants. The breakfast was continental with lots of bread, cheeses and a variety of cakes and cereals. We would recommend this hotel highly and Venice is a wonderful city we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 04SK
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't have been better. Was in Venice for a weekend and found it comfortable and clean and in an excellent location very close to the Vaporetto stop. The reception staff were most helpful and when our flight was cancelled to return home they welcomed us back for an extra night. I would highly recommend this lovely hotel for anyone staying on the Lido.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim45678
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and booked 2 rooms at the Panorama for 3 days at the end of August. The Hotel was superb, clean rooms, helpful staff, great access to Venice (just catch waterbus number 1 across the road). This is a great Hotel, you will not be disappointed....

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff, wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Euro_city_lover
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic 4 day break in Venice and have no hesitation in recommending the Panorama. The location on the Lido was actually very convenient - 15 minutes from San Marco by Vaporetto, quicker than many locations on the Grand Canal and it was nice to return to a quieter retreat. Even in November the city was pretty crowded, I cant imagine what it would be like in peak season, even more reason to have a haven such as the Panorama as a base. Other reviews have commented on the friendliness of the staff and we can vouch for this. Friendly and helpful, a nice combination. We paid a premium for a superior room with a lagoon view and did not regret it. The hotel is opposite the Valporetto stops and there is also a road out front but the windows kept the noise out. The room was a good size for Italy, comfortable and clean. It also and had a large bathroom with a shower but no bath, typically Italian. Breakfast was better than typical continental fare, fresh fruit, rolls, cold meats (salami and hams) and cheese, pastries, yoghurt,, cereals. The only negative thing was the lack of fresh juices, the orange and grapefruit were more like squashes. You could pay extra for the fresh variety. I would not accept the free trip to Murano again, you are placed under considerable sales pressure which I found uncomfortable- not the fault of the hotel and perhaps I was oversensitive - my girlfiend was less concerned. On the plus side the glass blowing demonstration was superb so if you have a thicker skin go for it! Murano is certainly worth a visit though, the beautiful glass works of art are fantastic - catch the Vaporetto (No 42) if you want to avoid the salesmen. Venice itself was wonderful, too much to describe here. A couple of tips though: you MUST go to San Giorgio - missed by many guide books you can go up the Camanile and from here you will have the best view of Venice - puts the view from the Campanile San Marco in the shade. It's cheaper too! Also, take the Secret Itinery tour in the Doge's Palace - facinating. Eating out can be hit and miss, try to get recommendations if possible. Avoid the Tratoria Da Biasini near the Piazzale Roma at all costs - terrible cold pasta, stale bread, expensive and unfriendly service, we ate there on our way home but wished we hadn't. However, we discovered that not all tourist traps are terrible. After a bad experience earier in the year in New York we were reluctant to try the canal side restaurants near Rialto, normally searching for back-street trattoria full of locals, but the view, sunshine and hunger got the better of us and we settled on Riva Del Vin. We had a delicious dried beef starter (enough for two) and then a couple of good pasta dishes. Some of the other restaurants were less good and more expensive apparently. We hope you enjoy Venice as much as we did, chosing the Panorama is a great place to start.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay when in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Diva_ms
Reviews.Content: After trying to find a reasonably priced hotel in Venice, we stumbled upon the Panorama that is on Lido(island just across from San Marco Square). It is truly a gem. Rooms are a good size, bathrooms larger than most in Italy, and spotlessly clean. There is a nice terrace where you can have a drink and people watch. It is located directly across from the water taxi/water bus landing which I thought might be noisy but isn't. The only boat sounds we heard were the fog horns one morning but those could be heard for miles. Lido is the place to stay when visiting Venice. It is a short water bus ride (they run every 10 minutes all day and night) from San Marco Square. The water transport from the airport stops right outside the hotel. The island has lovely shops and wonderful cafes and restaurants. It's an oasis after the hustle and bustle of the city. The hotel staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. When the guest computer in the lobby wasn't working one day I was invited to use the manager's computer in his office to check my email. Breakfast (included in room rate) is typical of Italian hotels. Definitely a place I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CHDH
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my boyfriend's birthday. Our room was upgraded to a junior suite for an additional 25 euros a night, which seemed very reasonable considering the amazing views we had of the lagoon. The room was large and clean and the little balconies were lovely. The staff at the Hotel Panorama were incredibly helpful and accomodating. My only regret is that we didn't stay longer than the weekend, but in the future, I won't stay anywhere else in Venice. We especially enjoyed utilising the terrace for breakfast (I can't really understand why anyone would choose to remain in the breakfast room when there are such amazing views to take in). The waitress knew immediately what we wanted and provided us with a tray so we could take our food and coffee upstairs. We also enjoyed a bottle of wine one evening on the terrace - no one said anything about us bringing our own, although we did also buy some beers from the bar. The 3 day pass (25 euros) is great for exploring Venice. We took the number 1 all the way up the Grand Canal and the number 52 around Venice - a great way to take in the sights. The manager at the Panorama recommended the Trattoria Favorita on the Lido for dinner and made the booking for us and drew us a map to find it. We had a great meal there on the Saturday night, sat outside in their garden and the scampi ravioli was amazing. The actual food in Venice wasn't brilliant (we ate pizza for lunch both days) but that restaurant was special. It was wonderful to explore Venice and then be able to return to the Lido to chill out. The beach is definitely worth checking out as well. It's only a 15 minute walk and the main street is lined with shops and cafes. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, pleased with our choice”
Reviews.Author: Gotothesun
Reviews.Content: The Panorama is on Venice Lido island, which is directly opposite the main island (10 min waterbus ride away). The hotel is right outside the waterbus stop, which concerned us initially, but we didn't have any noise from this and it was actually very convenient. It was nice to be able to escape the crowds of Venice to return to Lido & the short boat ride added to the fun. Buy a 11 Euro single waterbus ticket from airport (takes 45 mins), & the 72 hour waterbus ticket was very convenient for use for the rest of your stay (this is a separate company from the airport boat, so you cannot use it for the airport). Do not bother with tickets with extras, such as free use of toilets, just use the cafes you will eat at, anyway. Hotel was a medium size, clean, with a good standard of decor & the rooms were comfortable. The staff were very helpful & able to guide you with waterbuses and general information. The breakfast was a good, basic continental buffet in the ground floor dining room. On the 1st floor there is a veranda where you can sit, with views across the lagoon. We also thought paying extra for a lagoon-view room was worthwhile to appreciate Venice- otherwise you might as well be anywhere in the world. We paid 65 Euros for a 35 min gondola ride, don't let them con you into more, but it has to be experienced. Also most restuarants in Venice are disappointing- try to get recommendations. It is also worthwhile experiencing Venice at night & we found it easy to go back to the hotel to freshen up, before returning to the main island. If you have enough time, take the 15-20 minute walk to the other side of the Lido to the clean, organised & excellent beach. This hotel is not the height of luxury (you will have to pay very high prices for luxury in an already expensive Venice), but it is very comfortable and pleasant. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every one of its 4 stars & more”
Reviews.Author: KlausTheInspector
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels weâ€™ve ever stayed in, and it's not even in Venice. Hotel Panorama is a 15min boat ride from Piazzo San Marco on Lido island, the beach resort of Venice. Not a problem as boats run 24 hours a day and you shouldn't be waiting more than 15-20mins for one. Website doesn't do the hotel justice, making it look like the usual Venetian cheese fest of gold leaf, badly co-ordinated colours and cheap tacky paintings. Instead it totally lives up to it's 4 star rating, with an attitude and demeanour from staff that would give most 5 star hotels a run for their money, doing their best to help you with any problems you may have. Most of the rooms will have a water view of some sorts, although the best (and the most expensive) are right on the front of the hotel, giving unobstructed but distant views of the Palazzo Ducale & the Campanile. The Lido water bus stop is right next to the hotel which does distract a little from the effect, but noise is not a problem and we enjoyed sitting on the balcony and watching the general commotion in the lagoon as vaporetto and skyscraper-sized cruise liners dodge each other. Only the junior suites seem to have balconies, but anyone can use the fantastic terrace for the view. You could probably even sit here and drink supermarket-bought drinks without any trouble. Breakfast was the standard issue European nonsense of croissants, yogurts, and counterfeit cereals. An Englishmanâ€™s worst nightmare. Bizarrely (even the waitress seemed embarrassed to ask) coffee was an extra 2 euros. It's actually served on the ground floor, not the terrace as the website suggest so ask for a tray and take it upstairs for one of the best breakfast views in the world. I doubt we'll ever stay ANYWHERE else in the future. No pool, but for about 7 euros a day, you can use a section of private beach a 15min walk away on the other side of the Lido. The Panorama will loan beach towels for a small deposit in a variety of lavish carrier bags that guests richer than us have left behind. We booked through Venere for 170 euros (Â£117) a night. A quick search on Google should turn up promotional codes for this site that takes a further 4% off any bill. Check the hotels own website for short stay deals. Ignore the "nickel & dime" reviewer - the glass tour was discreetly suggested on checking in and never mentioned again. However, before you suspect Iâ€™m the manger in disguise Iâ€™ve got to find something wrong with the stay so, nit-pickingly, the only irritations I can think of were: No ice machine to chill supermarket bought drinks at 10% the price of the mini-bar. Reception canâ€™t change travellers cheques, leaving a long and frustrating search ahead as banks are generally closed and some restaurants won't accept credit cards. Like the rest of Europe, striking is a pastime for the ACTV water bus staff. These usually run for 24 or 48 hours, and could leave you at the mercy of costly water taxis that would murder your holiday budget. Check the ACTV website for news of any impending action - they're fairly infrequent, although when they do happen I doubt you will get more than a few weeks notice.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Ken 1235
Reviews.Content: We chose the Panorama after comparing the Trip Advisor ratings for Venice hotels. What a perfect choice. We fully support all the positive comments by previous visitors and were glad we paid the little extra for a superior room overlooking the lagoon (room 104). This room had fabulous views to the front and side as it was on the corner. Staff were friendly and very helpfull and I suppose I could just repeat what others have already said, however one further piece of advice:- Buy a 3 day vaparetto pass and use it to your advantage. Take the No. 1 all the way up the Grand Canal and back again. Then take the No.52 all the way around the island of Venice. Great way to see the sights. Make sure you use your vaparetto pass to jump on ond off at the best sights and it is extremely good value for money. Forget the extravagant water taxis, they don't know what to charge. Fabulous city, great restaurants, brilliant hotel Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff & Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were there for 3 nights. Hotel staffs were very helpful and cheerful compare with other hotels we stayed in Italy. Hotel is just located next to the Lido ferry and takes approximatley 38 minutes to Trian Station. Everything was great except some fly near the main entrance and lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service--Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: jazziekitty
Reviews.Content: Beware of the Hotel Panorama. They try to nickel-and-dime you to death and have bad customer service. I booked though a internet travel website for 2 nights in May. I requested a double room and called the hotel to confirm my reservations a few day before I went. I simply asked if the rooms have a view of the lagoon, and was told that the standard rooms do not, but the superior rooms did. The clerk seemed very eager to offer me a superior room for an extra 20 euros a night. He then said they would show me both types of rooms when I arrived and I could choose to upgrade to the superior room. When we checked-in, the clerk said they have a supeior room for us at 20 extra euros a night, and I said "No, thanks, we will just take the standard room". When we went to our room, it was obviosly their "superior room" as it was in front of the lagoon. I went to ask the clerk, and told him that I requested a standard room...why did he not understand me all the times I said it? Anyway, I was told that there were no more standard rooms left that night, and I would have to stay in our room, but the wouldn't charge us extra. However they would have to move us the next day. That night, I started unpacking, and thought I really did not want to move rooms, so I spoke to the same clerk, and said that I would be happy to pay for the upgraded room the next night, so not to have to move. He apparently did not understand me again, because the next day we were told that we have to change rooms. I had to repack all my stuff. At this point, I saw that it was useless to argue or explain anything else to them as they have obviously not understood anything I had said before. The clerk still insisted that I requested a superior room when I did not. Our standard room actually had a better lay-out, more windows, and more closet space than the previous superior room. And we still had a view of the lagoon on the side window. Bath room counter also more spacious. Overall rooms were decent sized, carpet was old, bathroom only has small shower cubicle. Breakfast was a meager affair. Coffee and Cappucino, hot chocolate, etc all came out of a machine, like the ones you get at gas stations. It was TERRIBLE coffee for Italy. If you wanted a "real" cofee or cappucino, you had to pay extra 3 euros. Juice was just watery squash, and there was some cereals, yogurt, cold meats, cheeses. Not what you would expect from a 4 star hotel. Service was terrible, only 1 waitress, and clearly you needed more to staff a breakfast service. Kept running out of food, cups, glasses. She was busy refilling food and clearing tables. Definitely will not return. They do not place customer satisfaction at the top of their priorities, be it the rooms or breakfast. They should not call themselves 4 stars and get away with doing things as cheaply as they can.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 3 night stay in Hotel Panorama. The staff were welcoming, helpful and friendly. As soon as we arrived, they went though main attractions and tours on both the surrounding islands and Venice. They also advised the best travel passes to buy, and arranged a water taxi to take us to the glass-blowing island free of charge. The location is a great retreat from the crowds in Venice, but close enough to enjoy the beauty of the island. Main spots on Lido are within walking distance, however you can hire bikes to tour further parts. All in all, it was a really relaxing and unoforgettable stay, and the hotel made it all the worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base”
Reviews.Author: davejay
Reviews.Content: The hotel Panorama is the perfect base for exploring Venice. Only 10 minute ferry ride to centre of Venice it is a quiet and cost effective alternative to the noise and bustle of Venice. The hotel is well presented, spotlessly clean and staffed by helpful and friendly staff. Rooms are not spacious but adequate and although our room overlooked the ferry terminal very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: rattys6
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Its perched on the edge of the Lagoon with perfect views of Venice on the other side. The staff are more than happy to help and will do their utmost to make your stay comfortable. The rooms are very nice, bathrooms are quite large however the shower cubicle in our bathroom was very small, definately not a standard size. The double bed was large and very comfortable which was much apprieciated after a full day walking around Venice! We had a great side view from our room which over looked the water bus stops. It was great to sit on the bed with the doors open and watch all the activity and there really was alot going on, water buses arriving every 5 minutes, as well as frequent arrivals of the larger ferries and also cars and buses on the road outside. It was a little noisy in my opinion but wouldn't put me off staying in the same room again. The continental breakfast was good and what you would expect. Tea's, coffee, cakes, crossiants, bread rolls, jams, ham, cheeses and a selection of cereal's. During the summer months breakfast is taken on the lovely terrace which has spectacular views over the Lagoon. From October they move it inside the hotel in the bar area, its a very small room and you may have a short wait till a table becomes free. Would definately stay at this hotel for future visits to Venice. Its got a great location, very accessible to Venice and the staff couldn't be more helpful or friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely base for exploring the Venetian islands”
Reviews.Author: garygadget
Reviews.Content: Ignore the review of the moron who thinks it's in Crete, this is an excellent hotel, and a real find. Bear in mind it's on Lido, which is (I think) a better base for exploring Venice, since it's not as crampled and full of tourists as the main Venice islands, and has some excellent restaurants and trattorias nearby - but Lido is a separate island, which means St Marks Square et al are a vaporetto (water bus) ride away. To avoid duplicating the comments of others, I'll tell you a couple of things I didn't know before I went. The hotel is right by the shore, and also just by the Vaporetti stop. The view from the lagoon facing rooms is fabulous - and you can see the massive cruise ships sailing up and down the Guidecca canal. If you can't get a lagoon room, the view from the terrace is stunning (don't miss the terrace - we did until our last night!). This makes it ideally placed for getting to the main Venice island - also where the Alilaguna boats which run from the airport dock - but I did worry about the noise, since the Vaporetti run from early in the morning until late at night. I needn't have - the double glazing is good, and the air conditioning is better, which means you'll have no trouble sleeping. All the staff were lovely, the standard of cleanliness within the hotel was excellent. There's a water taxi stop not far from the hotel, but be aware that water taxis don't normally wait there for pickups - if you want a water taxi best to ask at the hotel reception to ring for one. A corner of the hotel is given over to a bank branch, which means you have an ATM just around the corner from the hotel entrance. The hotel doesn't have any restaurant or room-service food, other than the breakfast, which is nothing to write home about, but it's adequate. From my (admittedly limited) experience of Venetian hotels that's not unusual. Food in the restaurant trattoria next door was good, food at the Belvedere hotel nearby not so good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: daviduk
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms and lovely bathrooms. Spectacular views towards St Marks Sq. Staff are fantastic, couldnt be more helpful both before and during our stay. Venice Lido is perfect - you have great beaches with all facilities on the one hand and the wonders of Venice on the other. Its in a very convenient location - the waterbus stop is immediately opposite the hotel. For Venice it's excellent value for money and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. Very highly recommended indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel_Willowslea
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the wonderful staff and lovely room my son and daughter in law had a wonderful honeymoon break - Nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on lido”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Lido for 5 days , Hotel was in excellent location to get anywhere by watertaxi ,right outside hotel door. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpfull with many tips given nothing too much trouble. Lido is the only place with beach so one tip is not to use it on weekends as all locals use beach so it was very busy. Food is expensive in many restraunts and menu is very much the same, so would highly recommend chinese restraunt round the back of hotel which was very enjoyable and half the price.Would recomend Hotel if you are staying on lido ,we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Panorama is a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: jenny_max_2005
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from Italy and we stayed at the Hotel Panorama on the Lido in Venice. It is a 10 minute water taxi ride from San Marco Square. The hotel was lovely, clean, and recently remodeled. The staff was very helpful and served a great breakfast. It was especially nice to leave the crowds and noise of Venice and take a cool, breezy water taxi ride to Lido and be dropped directly in front of our hotel. One evening we walked into town and enjoyed yet another gelato and hung with the locals. We highly recommend this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: JenniLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in June in the Hotel Panorama, and it was excellent. Location on Lido was great, just a 10/15 min boat ride away from st marks sq, and eating out was much more reasonably priced on Lido. Our room had a beautiful view of the lagoon, and I would definitely return to this hotel. Also excellent staff, couldn't have been more helpful! Room was a little small but the staff and location more than made up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Cheddar75
Reviews.Content: The Panorama Hotel is situated on Lido, a lovely island just across the water from the centre of Venice. I felt compelled to write a review of the hotel for you readers after seeing many other reviews of the same place when choosing my holiday destination and hotel at which to spend my 30th birthday with my girlfriend. Thank you so much to everybody for recommending this place â€“ you made our holiday! We purchased our rooms from the internet for just over Â£100 a night for a Superior Double room overlooking the Lagoon. When we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted by a lovely chap (all the staff are excellent) who showed us to our room (No. 105). It was very small, but lovely nonetheless, with a king size bed, wardrobe, dressing table with TV (7 channels, all Italian), safe, bedside tables, chest of drawers and a mini-bar. The bathroom was nice, and included a heated towel rail and a really nice wash basin and bidet. There was no bath, but a shower cubicle instead. There were double floor-to-ceiling windows in the bedroom and bathroom which opened out onto the small balcony overlooking the lagoon and waterbus stop. After showing us this room, the gentleman then took us upstairs to show us another room, which he said we could upgrade to for an extra 20 Euros per night. It was twice the size of the room downstairs, with a larger bathroom and a Jacuzzi bath with a shower head attached (no shower curtain or glass though â€“ there would be no room to stand up as it was more of an attic room). The massive downside to this room, however, was the fact that you could not see out of the window without having to walk up some steps and peer out of the small window at the end of the room. Because the room was darker, lacked a proper shower and cost more, we opted for the smaller one downstairs. Great choice! The Positives: Lovely staff; fantastic shower; nice complementary breakfast (with plenty of choice); clean, cosy rooms with great view; situated in a lovely location â€“ ideal for the waterbus and only 8 minutes from a beautiful beach! The Negatives: 90% of the things in the mini-bar were MONTHS out of date! Bed wasnâ€™t the most fantastic I have ever slept in; breakfast coffee and toast (amongst other things) were at an additional cost; I was slightly disappointed by restaurant recommendations made by the staff, but that wasnâ€™t really their fault because there are seemingly very few excellent places to eat in Venice. I have tried to write a balanced review on the Panorama Hotel, but please donâ€™t be put off by the negatives! I would whole-heartedly book this hotel again, without hesitation. I would definitely stay on Lido again â€“ it is a beautiful little island with a great beach. If you are a couple and want the most romantic place on earth to stay â€“ go to Venice! Partner that with the Panoroma Hotel and youâ€™ll NOT be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: CVCVws
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 14 year old son and I just returned from a stay at the Hotel Panorama. The staff was top notch - wonderfully helpful. Breakfast great! Room was sparkling clean with a nice view. We loved staying on Lido and taking the water taxi in each day (it is only 12 minutes) and the ride is fantastic! Lido was wonderful - great beach and restaurants! When you get off the Alilaguna (the water ferry from the airport) you will be right across the street from this hotel. I saw people dragging their luguage all over Venice trying to find their hotels and felt very smart at our choice. My only complaint - new more comfortable beds and pillows, plus maybe wine and snacks around 6pm in the cafe - but then you may have to up the rate. With these changes I would have to give this little hotel 4+ rating. Stay here, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: numbereight
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Panorama - 18th - 20th March. We arrived early and our rooms were ready. The hotel is on the lagoon front right by the waterbus stop, which is a blessing after a long day sight seeing. The hotel is very clean and well maintained, staff were exceptional providing maps, excellent recommendations for local restuarants etc, breakfast had a wide range of fresh produce - fruit, cereal, breads, croissants, cheeses, meats etc. The rooms would be considered 'cosy' by USA standards, but they are clean and comfortable, you could see the whole of venice from the loo too! We found no inconvenience with staying on the lido, it made a nice change from being in the city, the number 1 bus provides a 10 minute service and they are on time. The hotel also orgainsed a trip to a glass factory in Murano for free, we then stayed on the island and shopped, They have some wonderful glass jewellery if you are on a budget. From here we then caught a ferry to Burano where the lace is made. Here we found some great deals on silk scarfs all very original. Burano is very pretty and colourful. From here we caught the ferry back to the lido. An excellent day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Drewswlon
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for a trip to Venice - only 15 minutes from St Marks by boat, and the boat station is right in front of the Hotel. Well presented rooms (if a bit small) great staff (helpful without being pushy). No restaurant in the evenings and the bar closes as 2100h, but the local recommendations from reception were fine. Great value out of season, but I imagine a rather fuller price in the Summer. I certainly plan to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Staff make this hotel awsome.”
Reviews.Author: sarah333
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a holiday to Venice 17 - 20th Feb. We had initially booked a suite but i e-mailed the hotel a couple of days before we left to make sure that everything was in order and they told me that there had been a double booking on our suite and we could have it for our 2nd and 3rd night but not the 1st. I decided that rather than us messing about moving about we'd just change to a different room. They changed us to a room in the attic, which still had the jacquzzi bath that i wanted and a view of St Marks basin. The room was nicely decorated was clean - there was a mini bar, safe tv etc.. at because of the mix up with our suite they had left us a bottle of sparkling wine which was a nice touch. There was alo a massive bowl of fruit too. They only problem with the room was that it was soo hot! All the other rooms must have had their heating on and because heat rises it all seemed to gather in our room! So we had to have the windows mide open all night else we would have melted but then this resulted in us being up most of the night with the noise from the water bus station. However, when the windows were closed you couldn't hear anything - so it was a case of suffer the heat or suffer the noise! The breakfast was simple was tasty - being lactose intolerant it was quite hard to find things i could eat! But the coffee was lovely! The staff were so super friendly and did everything they could to make our stay more enjoyable. They all spoke great English and gave us maps and told us where to go etc.. which was really helpful. They arranged a free taxi and entrance for us to the glass museum at Murano which ran really smoothly with no problems etc... Being on the Lido didn't make a difference because there are boats coming all the time to go to St Marks square and it was nice to take a trip over the water. Unfortunately we didn't find 1 nice restaurant in Venice but that's hardly the hotels fault! I'm sure there are lots of hotels like this in Lido and other parts of Venice but the staff here really make the difference to choosing this hotel to another.

Reviews.Title: “The Panorama is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: rachel337
Reviews.Content: It was with some trepidation that I booked this hotel over the internet with nothing but the previous reviews of Trip advisor reviewers to go on. The booking process, conducted via email was courteous and even incuded detailed emailed directions on how to find the hotel, which ferry line to get, the cost of tickets and a map. That's service! We set off cautious but hopeful to Venice. The trip accross the lagoon to the Lido was incredible, a real experience and very easy. You buy your tickets in the airport concourse then board a free shuttle bus (or Navette) to the port. Do not mistake the floating dock for the boat and crush to get on it! Far better to stand on the solid ground as the square boat like contraption that serves as a boarding platform rocks quite alarmingly! When the alilaguna ferry arrives the staff are very organised. Just tell them which stop you want to get off at (Lido for the Hotel panorama) and they will store your luggage securely and give it back to you as you are ready to disembark. It takes about 50 minutes to the Lido from the airport. When we got to our destination there was a mixup. We did not know that the dock opposite the hotel Panorama where the boats all usually stop was out of action for a week for the airport boat only. The Hotel Panorama had emailed us as soon as they knew with directions of how to board the free navette to outside the hotel but as I only have email at work and had been off for two days previous to my holiday we didn't get the message. We ended up walking a considerable distance with heavy bags. If this happens to you and you come in at anywhere other than Lido stop, look for the free bus!! When we reached the Panorama, hot and sweaty and stressed they greated us like longlost friends, offered us free drinks to get readjusted and appologised profusely for us not getting their email! The staff could not have been sweeter. we were shown to our room which we had paid extra for in order to have a lagoon view. The room was charming. well decorated with a lovely marble bathroom (shower only) and of an adequate size. The view over Venice was gorgeous. Two small niggles about the room. 1) not much cupboard/wardrobe space 2) very little shelf space in the bathroom to put make-up, wash stuff, etc. However, the staff at the hotel tell us that this is being changed as they refurbish the rooms. Not that they look like they need refurbishing. We came for 4 nights and there was just about enough room for our stuff (I admit I am not of the minamlist school of packing but neither am I in the habit of bringing the kitchen sink.) If you are coming for longer, you may need to edit your packing or enquire if they have added bigger wardrobes. The breakfast is ample with a reasonable selection of different breads, cheeses, pastries fruit and yoghurt. The coffee is delicious. where the panorama really comes into its own is the staff who are so helpful and knowledgable and dedicated to helping you get the most out of their glorious city. Of additional massive benefit is the location. The hotel couldn't be closer to the main no.1 line into Venice. It takes about 12 minutes to reach St Marks Square or San Zaccharia as the stop is called and what a fabulous priviledge it is make that awesome journey every morning. the view and the experience of cruising up the grand canal is just incredible. It is so beautiful it almost made me want to weep. Venice itself is incomparable in its beauty, its majesty and just the sheer spectacle it provides. Every courner you turn gives a new magical view. This is a city for walking. Bring comfortable shoes and tramp to your hearts delight. Buy a three day ferry pass and hop on and off the different ferry lines and explore every nook and cranny. As a shop-a-holic I can report that there are bargains to be found. In the St Marks square area you have your designers alongside small boutiques. The designer stuff is standard prices but don't shop in the boutiques here. If you walk not more than five minutes from the square you will see the same items for less. the further you walk the more you can save. For example, the same pair of shoes near St Marks 100 euros; in Dorsoduro, 65 euros. The two best authentic Venetian shopping finds for me were the street that runs parallel to the Grand Canal if you get off at Ca Doro. Walk up the small alley behind the ferry stop and turn right. Excellent bargains in glassware to be found here. the second was a little harder to find. there is a lovely little street that runs from behind the Rialto Bridge all the way to the academia, zig zagging all the way. You need to get off at the Academia and walk just to the right of the gallery entrance, weave your way kind of straight on and right and you will see various piazzas opening up in front of you. the main flow of traffic will take you the right way, just go with it. It is fascinating and a good place to find classic shoes and bags. Another good road is the Frizzaria that goes off of the St Marks Square area. Lovely shoe shops! We visited in October and were concerned about the possibility of Aqua Alta (high water and flooding). well, it was a certainty and an absolute hoot! Don't worry about it, the Venetians are well prepared. walk on the duckboards that are laid out on all main routes and keep you dry, as long as you don't mind getting friendly with the other tourists as you all try to navigate your way around. Be prepared to get a little damp in the shoe area if you go off the beaten track or to get hopelessly lost trying to navigate via high ground but it is just good fun and all gone by about 11.30 am. The sight of st Marks Square, filled with water and being sloshed through by the locals in their Prada wellies is something to behold! Lido itself is pleasant. there is a nice little main street with a fabulous Deli called Rizzo. We cut the eating out costs by having one evening where we sat in our room and watched the sun set over Venice and ate sicilian cherry tomatoes, freshly baked walnut bread, Dolcelatte and proscuttio, with fresh pears and peaches for desert all brought from Rizzo. the Venetian food is good. Plenty of choice and if you stick to the places frequented by locals, the standard is high and the cost is average. One place NOT to eat Bentigodi near the Ghetto Nuevo. we walked for miles to find it as it had a good review in Time Out to find innedible food. It was truly awful with our meal (tuna Steak and fillet steak respectively) coming to the table nearly raw (not rare- there is a diference). Go to Venice, stay at the Panorama and have a wonderful time. This city is the the most amazing in the world and the Panorama is a good quality hotel, fastidiously clean with fabulous staff who will really help you get the most of your stay. They even stored our luggage for us after we checked out and helped us carry it over the road to get the ferry. Thank you Panorama!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Panorama through Expedia in the UK on a farily late deal. Firstly, the transfer from the airport to the Lido is about an hour and can be longer if you get an old Aliliaguna not the new ones. The Hotel is right in front of the boat stop so don't be worried about finding it. The staff were excellent at all times, friendly conversations willing to help and nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are a little small but very clean if not a little cold with no obvious way of heating the room up. I think this is a rouse to get couples closer so they keep warm and with such excellent views across the Lagoon, who can blame them. There was a little work on the building going on while we there but it was very substantial and only woke us one morning. The breakfast was sparce in choice but get there early enough and there is plenty to fill up on. There were all the facilities you can need and it's location is a great selling point as you can see the hotel as you come across the lagoon in a water bus. Our tip is that a travelcard is must, and can be bought at the boat stop in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not too close...not too far...and nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, the staff was AWESOME. They were so nice and helpful. Second, the location was perfect. Not too close to be overcrowded and overpriced. But not so far that its remote or hard to get to. Just hop on the water bus (which you have to do for any hotel in Venice) and head toward the hotel. Third, breakfast was nice. You can sit and enjoy a solid breakfast while looking out at Venice. Real nice! Fourth, right around the corner is a great little neighborhood where my wife and I could enjoy a nice (non-crowded) walk to great restaraunts. In that tucked away little neighborhood I had the best calamari of my life. It was so good I am telling strangers about it on the internet at this moment!!! I am very budget-conscious but I also want to stay somewhere nice. I would highly recommend this hotel to people like me. Venice is way overrated. But this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & orderly, but not worth it by US standards.”
Reviews.Author: footsore2
Reviews.Content: This former Chicago travel agent & his new bride booked the Panorama for Oct. 9-12, 2004 thru Hotels, looked for a place away from the touristic mania there with (comparatively) modest rates and I settled on this conveniently-located one on the Lido (a long, breakwater island of beaches and villas) and right at the "vaporetto" pier as the best compromise. While it looked and was as described, it was just a common, older, 2-star tourist hotel nowhere worth the $262.00/nt. (this being Venice) which it cost. On arriving after a long vaporetto wait, drag & ride from the train station with heavy bags from a Med. cruise, we learned without prior notice that our paid-for room had been resold, that the responsible idiot/clerk "had been fired" (rubbish!) and that they had placed us into a friendly-competitor hotel, the Best Western Hotel/Villa Biasuti nearby and would pay to cab us there. Biasuti was MUCH nicer, Panorama paid for our first 2 nights, but then dragged us back for our last night, which wasn't nearly as nice. Despite the better, front-facing room we got with good views of the lagoon, the city and maritime traffic, it was just a small room of 11x12', no AC, no window screens, an old bed and one of those tiny, improvised shower stalls in which no 6'2", 215-lb guest could barely turn around, a joke by US standards. The included breakfast was average, the hotel and room were clean and in good repair, but furnished with a Hitler-era decor which needed a lot of help, preferably a woman's. I'd never want to stay in any room toward the back or sides; not at these prices.
