While the middle-aged, male, front-desk staff acted very personably, their words and gestures rang false and could not make up for having bounced us out without notice at the high prices which this simple hotel charged. Yet, as sleeping out on the Lido was definitely the way to go, just stay at the Villa Biasuti or elsewhere as this little hotel wasn't worth more than $130 at best. For $262, I expect a 4 or 5-star place and will stay in the US and $-denominated nations until the ridiculous pricing of the Euro comes down. On balance, I conclude that this place was well located, poor in property, good in staff, so-so in execution and not worth anywhere its high prices. I would stay elsewhere,but on the Lido. Try the Biasuti.

Reviews.Title: “yummy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: having spent 3 nights at hotel panorama we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We only stayed in a standard room but even this was very comfortable, with all the extras you expect, a very good heating system in the room and a great view from the window overlooking the waterbus station and the lagoon. The reception staff were very friendly and were eager to ensure you enjoyed your stay and offered plenty of useful advice on places to eat on lido, waterbuses and the main attractions in the main part of the city. Breakfast was served till 10 so it wasnt a case of having to get up early each day and the selection of food was fantastic (and the coffee was delicious!!) After getting to grips with the waterbus timetables and routes, the fact that we were staying on an island away from the touristy bit didnt prove to be a problem; we enjoyed a nice walk to the sandy side of the Lido where there is a beautiful beach, which was very pleasant even in mid december!! We would definately recommend staying at hotel panorama! :D

Reviews.Title: “really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Patti L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in October of 2004. The room was small, but clean, with beautiful light fixtures from Murano. The bathroom was beautiful and quite large for a European hotel. The staff couldn't have been any more helpful. We had a late departure, and they let us store our luggage with them, and offered all of their amenities to us, including a room to change in, until it was time for us to leave, which wasn't until 4 pm. They will bend over backwards for you to help with finding things, giving you detailed maps, and arranging taxis for you. The water bus is right across the street, so really convenient to get to Venice, and the hotel is within walking distance of the shops and beach on Lido. The continental breakfast had a good variety of things, plenty to fill you up for a day of sightseeing. I would definitely go back to this hotel. Definitely worth staying a little ways away from the bustle of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ebach17
Reviews.Content: After having two very nice hotels in Milan and Verona I found this one to be a disappointment. Small touches like having to pay for certain coffees in the morning were a bit much. The room was quite small. Before we were able to access our room we were taken to other rooms to see if we wanted to upgrade for an exra 40 Euros a night. So, when we finally were shown to our room we were told, "you see, this room is not as nice and much smaller." I found that to be a less than favorable introduction. I was willing to go that extra ride on the waterbus in order to find a nice hotel, but I would say don't bother. This is a very average hotel at a higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: BJM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location as you are right by the vaporetto stops and it is a short walk to many of the restaurants and shops. The hotel is well maintained and the rooms (while abit small) are clean and well furnished. what really made the hotel stand out for us was the staff. They were friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived. Unfortunately my husband was ill after our first day and spent the remainder of our few days break in bed. Our flight was not until the late evening but the hotel offered to move us to another room (ours was booked) between check out time and flight so he could stay in bed. They charged us no extra and booked us a water taxi and personally carried our bags to the stop to help us on our way. Would definately stay there again - hopefully in health next time.
